texts.en: Ma. Dolores has owned and operated her variety store for more than 16 years. She is thankful for her previous loans which helped her to increase her stock of grocery items. Ma.Dolores is married to a dispatcher of a bus company.The couple has been blessed with three children. Ma. Dolores would like to borrow again to sustain her variety store. To make her goal possible, she is asking for a loan of PHP 18,000. She will use this amount to buy grocery items and rice.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and rice to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is single, 50 years old, and lives with her parents in Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. Teresita is operating a sari-sari (variety) store to earn a living. She has been in this business for 12 years and she earns 10,000 PHP every month. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more goods for her general store. She joined GDMPC in 2013. In the future, Teresita will use her income to support her parents's needs, such as medicine Teresita wishes that her business would be more progressive.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for her store.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a 45-year-old married mother of five children, one still in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Rosalie has a food vending business in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a PHP 5,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, hot dogs, spices, and sausage.

Rosalie has been in this business for four years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, hot dogs, spices, and sausage for her food production business

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиёр весёлый парень в возрасте 23 года ,не женат. Его отец  умер когда ему была 3 годика. Так как у них большая семья его маме было трудно справится с обеспечением семьи. Тогда были трудные времена жаль что он был маленьким и не мог  помочь маме. Теперь он вырос и работает строителем. У него хорошая зарплата и он помогает семье. Его мама очень счастлива что вырастила такого хорошего сына. Но к сожалению счастья не бывает много и недавно Бахтиёру стало плохо. Он обратился к врачу и врач назначил ему лечение.  Ему срочно понадобились деньги и он обратился в Арванд за кредитом. Заранее благодарен за поддержку!!!
texts.en: Bakhtiyor is a cheerful young man. He is 23 years old and unmarried. His father died when he was three years old. Since they have a large family, it was difficult for his mother to cope with looking after the family. During difficult times he was sorry that he was small and unable to help his mother. Now he has grown up and is a construction worker. He has a good wage and helps his family. His mother is very happy that she has raised such a good son. But unfortunately one never has too much good fortune and not long ago Bakhtiyor fell ill. He consulted a doctor and the doctor has prescribed him some treatment. He urgently needs money and has applied to Arvand for a loan. He is grateful in advance for the support!

loans.use: to buy medical treatment.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.fr: Eunice est une femme mariée résidant à Adidogomé avec deux enfants à charge. Eunice est âgée de 29 ans et est une revendeuse de fournitures scolaire et du charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile et dans sa propre boutique. Pour financer son achat, Eunice  nécessite ce prêt pour commander des cartons de cahiers et des sacs de charbon de bois afin de réaliser plus de bénéfice et soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille puis permettre une bonne éducation à leurs enfants
texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman who lives in Adidogomé with two children to care for. Eunice is 29 years old and resells school supplies and charcoal. She purchases supplies four times a month at the market and resells them from her home and in her own shop.

Eunice needs this loan to pay for supplies. She will order boxes of notebooks and bags of charcoal in order to make a larger profit and support her husband with the family's expenses and then help their children get a good education.

loans.use: to buy five boxes of notebooks and six bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Jerson Lenin

texts.es:
Jerson tiene 36 años de edad, reside en compañía de su esposa y su pequeña hija de 3 años, obtuvo su título de secundaria como bachiller técnico en computación, seguidamente inició sus estudios universitarios en donde obtuvo su título de ingeniero en negocios.
Actualmente se encuentra laborando y junto a su esposa son el sustento para el hogar.
Jerson es una persona responsable, honesta, leal, fiel, muy esforzado y ético, considera que su motivación se centra en poder enriquecer sus conocimientos, para poder aplicarlos en su diario vivir, en la empresa para la cual labora y luchar por su familia mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
Desea contribuir a su país, mediante la educación que esta adquiriendo ya que es sinónimo de progreso y desarrollo personal de alguien que desea superarse y optar por mejores oportunidades en la vida.
Jerson proviene de una familia humilde ya que sus padres se dedican al campo y desde pequeño recuerda haber atravesado momentos difíciles, debido a factores económicos que sin duda mantenían a su familia totalmente unida,tiene 6 hermanos y junto a sus padres aprendieron el trabajo duro y sacrificado, su padre luchó para llevar el sustento a su familia, claro ejemplo de vida que Jerson decidió tomar para ponerlo en practica con su familia. Recuerda los consejos de su padre -Luchar por lo que quería en la vida, a pesar de lo mucho que requiriera, lograr sus metas.
Sus planes a futuro se centran en poder optar a una mejor oportunidad de empleo y tener su propio negocio que pueda generar oportunidades de empleo a otros jóvenes con deseo de superación.
texts.en:
Jerson is 36 years old. He lives with his wife and his little 3-year-old daughter. He obtained a high school degree with a technical certification in computer science. After that, he started his university studies, where he earned a degree in business engineering.

He is currently working, and together with his wife he is supporting his household.

Jerson is a responsible, honest, loyal, faithful, ethnical and very hard-working person. He believes that his motivation is to focus on enriching his knowledge so that he can apply it in his daily life and in the business where he works, and also to work hard to improve his family's quality of life.

He wants to contribute to his country through the education he is acquiring, since it is synonymous with progress and personal development of someone who wants to get ahead and choose better opportunities in life.

Jerson comes from a humble family; his parents worked in the countryside and he remembers going through difficult times in his childhood due to economic factors. However, these kept his family totally united; he has 6 siblings, and together with their parents they learned to work hard and make sacrifices. His father worked hard to support his family, as a clear living example which Jerson decided to put into practice with his own family. He remembers his father's advice: Fight for what you want in life and achieve your goals, in spite of all the work required.

His plans for the future are focused on finding better work opportunities and having his own business which can generate jobs for other young people with a desire to get ahead.

loans.use: pursue his master's studies in business management, specializing in finance.

loans.name: José

texts.pt:
O senhor José de 65 anos de idade é pensionista, casado e pai de 10 filhos todos a estudar, vive na casa própria.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar  cimento, areia, pedra, barrotes para dar continuidades a construção de sua casa.
O seu sonho é  adquirir uma viatura mini bus para fazer transporte inter-provincial de forma a  reforçar a renda familiar.
Diz que o seu maior desafio é a insuficiência de fundos e para supera-los  conta com ajuda da sua esposa também pensionista. Com o empréstimo anterior iniciou a construção de sua casa e comprou alguns bens pois antes vivia na casa arrendada.
texts.en:
65-year-old José is retired. He is married and the father of ten children, who go to school. He owns the house where he lives.

He says that he will use the loan to buy cement, sand, stones, and bars to continue building his house.

His dream is to buy a small bus to provide inter-province transport services, with the intention to strengthen the family income.

He says that his biggest challenge is the lack of funding, and his wife, who is retired also, helps him to overcome it. With the previous loan, he started to build his house and bought some goods. He used to live in a rented house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, stones, and bars to continue building his house.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.pt:
O senhor Manuel de 32 anos de idade é comerciante, casado pai de 1 filho ainda menor de idade e vive na casa própria, muito cedo abandonou os estudos para ajudar a sua mãe nas atividades comerciais de forma a sustentar os irmãos, vive de negocio de frutas que vende de forma ambulante através de um triciclo.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo, pretende comprar uvas, maçãs, tâmaras, morangos, para revender.
O seu sonho é  crescer no negocio, ter um estaleiro de venda de material de construção reforçado assim a renda familiar.
Diz que o seu maior desafio e trabalhar para adquirir um meio de transporte e abraçar outra área de negocio porem enfrenta dificuldades financeiras.
texts.en:
Manuel, 32, is a businessman. He is married and has an underage son. He owns the house where he lives. He quit his studies very early to help his mother with her business in order to sustain his siblings. He sells fruits as a street vendor, using a tricycle.

He says that he will use the requested amount to buy grapes, apples, dates, and strawberries for resale.

His dream is to expand his business, and open a constructor’s yard to sell construction materials and improve his family’s income.

He says that his biggest challenge is to work to buy a vehicle and explore other business opportunities. However, he faces financial difficulties.

loans.use: to buy grapes, apples, dates, and strawberries for resale.

loans.name: Zaynabkhon

texts.en:
Zaynabkhon is a generous woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1977. She is living in a big town with her family. She is married and has five children.

Her husband is a constructor. She is a teacher. She teaches students at secondary school.

She is going to start a new business in order to have additional income for living and ensuring her children. She wants to trade agricultural products such as watermelon, greens, vegetables and fruits. She is interested in agriculture and wants to try the business.

She hopes her willingness and striving will be efficient and successful for her business. She is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to buy her first goods and agricultural products to trade.

She wishes to have a better business and good income for living.

loans.use: to buy her first goods and agricultural products to trade.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
People who are looking for a house to rent always consider the monthly rental, the accessibility of the location, and the neighbors. Owning an apartment, on the other hand, is very complex since you need to consider many things. It should have a strong foundation, the ceiling should not leak every time it rains, it should be well-ventilated, and the place should be accessible for the market, schools and hospitals. This is a business which doesn’t require day-to-day monitoring, but the quality of the house itself has to be maintained.

Norma is grateful for the money lent to her by lenders participating in the Kiva program, and the loan CCT granted last year. The amount helped her to buy materials for house renovation.

This year, Norma has applied for another loan of PHP 13, 000 for the maintenance of her house rental business, so that she will be ready for any future calamities. Moreover, the people renting from her will be comfortable and satisfied with their stay.

Norma regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony and her business experiences, to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship, and to listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationships with other partners, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and maintenance of her rental house.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en: Jonalyn is 29 years old and is married. She earns an income managing a store where she sells grocery items and uses her profits to reinvest in her business. She is requesting for a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase more merchandise to sell. She will buy canned goods, noodles, soap and shampoo. She hopes to continue managing a good flow of sales in her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, soap and shampoo to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 45 years old and married.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business, raising chickens in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her chickens.

Jocelyn has been raising chickens for three years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccine, vitamins and other supplies to raise her chickens.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is 50 years old and married with 8 children. Four of them are still in school and Gemma works very hard to provide for them. Gemma has run a general store in the Philippines for 5 years. She requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, beverages, bread, milk, coffee, spices, shampoo, soap, sugar, and other items. She would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, drinks, bread, milk, coffee, spices, shampoo, soap, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Farouk

texts.en:
Farouk is a repeat borrower to UGAFODE. He is single but with two children, and he is a resident of Wabigalo Kibuli- a city outskirt.

He has applied for a loan of UGX 5,000,000 to boost his shoe selling business. Mr. Farouk is faced with the challenge of low working capital that leads to low turn-up of customers and business. So he is so hopeful that if financed, he will attract more of a market for his shoes.

He is so grateful for UGAFODE microfinance and Kiva funds that have helped his business grow/expand.

Pictured is the client and the UGAFODE credit officer (left to right).

loans.use: to buy stock of shoes to sell

loans.name: Elina

texts.en:
Elina is a single woman who has no children. She owns a house that has piped water and electricity. She cites food as being her greatly monthly expense.

She has been operating a beauty salon business for the past two years. Her potential customers are her fellow neighbors and people at the market place. She dreams of earning more income and incorporating more hairdressing skills in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and hair conditioners for her beauty salon business

loans.name: Dama

texts.fr: Agée de 51 ans, Dama est une femme divorcée qui vit à Adidogomé avec trois enfants à charge. Pour favoriser son épanouissement, Dama vend des produits d’alimentations générales et réalises son revenu grâce à ce commerce. Ama s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des cartons de spaghettis, des sacs de détergents et des cartons de tomates, Dama sollicite ce crédit pour financer son achat et avoir une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Aged 51 and with three children dependent on her, Dama is a divorced woman who lives in Adidogomé. In order to foster her well-being, Dama sells various groceries and makes her living thanks to this business. She stocks up three times a month in the market.

To order some cartons of spaghetti, sacks of detergent, and cartons of tomatoes, Dama is requesting this loan to cover her purchase and have a good profit margin so as to cover the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy 10 cartons of spaghetti, 10 cartons of tomatoes, and 10 bags of detergent.

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.pt:
O senhor Arnaldo de 56 anos de idade   é operário agrícola, casado pai de 1 filho já maior de idade sustenta 2 netos que vivem com ele  na casa própria.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo este  pretende comprar janelas, e fazer instalação elétrica na sua casa de 2 quartos.
O seu sonho é  ampliar a sua casa com uma sala, varanda, mobilar para confortar a sua família.
Diz que o seu maior desafio e insuficiência de fundos e para supera-los conta com ajuda de sua esposa que faz machambas e que com os créditos anteriores fez a atual casa onde vive.
texts.en:
Arnaldo, 56, works in agriculture. He is married and has an adult son. He sustains two grandchildren who live with him in a house he owns.

He says that he is planning to use the requested amount to buy windows and install electricity in his 2-bedroom house.

His dream is to enlarge his house by building a living room, a porch, and buying some furniture to give his family a comfortable life.

He says that his biggest challenge is the lack of funding. His wife, who grows food, helps him to overcome it. With the previous loans, he built the house in which he lives now.

loans.use: to buy windows, and install electricity in his 2-bedroom house.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 51 years old and married with 11 children. Five of her children are presently in school. Myrna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, drinks, bread, milk, coffee, spices, shampoo, soap, sugar, and other items.

Myrna has previously borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF. She has run the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from selling local delicacies, which she has done for 26 years. She successfully repaid her last loan and she has requested a new loan to further build her businesses. Myrna aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, drinks, bread, milk, coffee, spices, shampoo, soap, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Nachantai Group

texts.en:
Dam’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater. These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.

Dam and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable. Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits. Dam and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets.

The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years, filter users, like Dam’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs. The man in the center back row signed the Kiva Waiver but was not included in the final loan as this person paid 100% of the amount owed to TerraClear.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Allan Leonel

texts.es:
Allan es un joven de 30 años de edad, soltero que vive en compañía de sus padres, esta por finalizar su carrera universitaria en el área de arquitectura. Previamente obtuvo su título de secundaria como bachiller en ciencias y letras contando con el apoyo de sus padres hasta hoy en día por no encontrarse laborando.
Comenta que el vivir con sus padres y contar con el apoyo de ellos, le ha motivado para seguir y concluir con sus estudios, ya que siempre se han esforzado por brindarle la mejor enseñanza de vida a base de valores, sacrificios y consejos de vida. Allan es un joven extrovertido, creativo y con fluidez de palabra para interactuar con los demás en cualquier situación que se le presente, es un joven que hace reír a los demás y que brinda un apoyo solidario en situaciones difíciles, es amigable y sincero con las personas que le rodean.
Su motivación cada día es poder culminar sus estudios y optar a un trabajo digno que le permita mejorar sus condiciones de vida y brindar un apoyo a sus padres ya que se siente muy agradecido por el respaldo que le han brindado y espera pronto poder compensar ese esfuerzo tan grande que por el han hecho.
Desea aportar nuevas ideas para proyectos habitacionales, que puedan generar oportunidades a las personas de escasos recursos, mediante empleo y a la vez mediante la oportunidad de optar por una vivienda para sus familias.
adicional a su pasión por los diseños, el canto es uno de sus talentos ya que en ocasiones ha participado en grabaciones profesionales con personas que se dedican a la música y talento nacional.
Desea adquirir un empleo que le genere estabilidad económica y mejores oportunidades de crecimiento ya que desea continuar con sus estudios de maestría luego de adquirir una experiencia laboral.
texts.en:
Allan is a 30 year old youth who is single and lives with his parents. He is finishing his university studies in Architecture. He has previously obtained his Secondary education graduating in Sciences and Letters relying on the support of his parents. Up to now he has not found any work.

He comments that living with his parents and having their support has motivated him to continue and complete his studies. They have always made an effort to provide him with the best life teachings, based on values, sacrifice and advise for living. Allan is a young extrovert, creative, who speaks fluidly so he can interact with others in any situation that may occur. He is a youth who makes others laugh and provides supportive help in difficult situations. He is friendly and sincere with the people around him.

His motivation each day is to complete his studies and choose dignified work that will allow him to improve his living conditions and provide support to his parents as he feels very grateful for the backing they have provided him. He hopes to repay the great effort that has been made for him.

He wants to bring new ideas to housing projects that can provide opportunities for people of low resources, through employment and at the same time choosing a house for their families. Besides his love of design, singing is one of his talents and at times he has participated in professional recordings with people who work in music and national talent.

He wants to find a job which generates economic stability and better opportunities for growth as he wants to continue with studying his masters after acquiring some work experience.

loans.use: to complete his university studies in architecture.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida works hard to support six children. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,400 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to invest in a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses. Loida is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp.

loans.name: Maria Magnolia

texts.en:
Maria Magnolia is a married woman with 3 children. She is 38 years old and all 3 of her children are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Maria Magnolia has run a fish vending business in the Philippines for 5 years. Maria Magnolia requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her local market. She would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her local market.

loans.name: Orbelina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Orbelina, de 27 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado en el centro escolar de su comunidad y desde hace nueve años está acompañada, su pareja es un hombre muy trabajador que se dedica a la agricultura, junto a él tiene dos hijos de 8 y 6 años de edad que están estudiando.

Orbelina, es ama de casa pero también tiene un pequeño negocio de crianza de aves de corral (gallinas), este oficio lo aprendió desde muy pequeña, porque su familia se dedicaba a eso; ahora de esa manera ayuda a su esposo, porque la agricultura en estos tiempos que no ha llovido está difícil cosechar granos. 

Orbelina, necesita el préstamo para comprar gallinas, concentrado para poder ayudar a su familia en esta situación tan mala que están pasando.

Orbelina, sueña con tener una mejor calidad de vida para su familia y poder darles el estudio a sus hijos, para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Orbelina is 27 years old. She studied up to the sixth grade in the community school. She married nine years ago. Her partner is a hardworking man who works in agriculture. They have two children, aged 8 and 6, who go to school.

Orbelina works as a housewife, but she also has a small business: she raises hens. She learned this activity when she was a little girl, because her family worked with that. This is how she now helps her husband, because it has not rained and it is difficult to grow cereals.

Orbelina needs this loan to buy hens and animal feed, in order to help her family to overcome this difficult situation.

Orbelina dreams of having a better quality of life with his family, and giving her children the opportunity to study and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy chickens and animal feed.

loans.name: Dúo Pacorral Group

texts.es:
DUO PACORRAL

Doña Flavia es originaria de la aldea Pacorral del municipio del Tecpan, Guatemala ella tiene 41 años de edad bajo su responsabilidad esta 1 hija menor de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano y a la crianza de animales.
El crédito que ella recibió lo invirtió para comprar mas materia prima para sus tejidos, ya que a veces por falta de material no puede realizar sus tejidos, también compro otros marranitos para la crianza y concentrado para alimentarlos.
Ella sueña con ampliar más su negocio, ya que de esa forma ella obtendrá mejores ganancias y poder mejorar su casa donde vive.
Ella a tenido otros créditos kivas, gracias a Dios a podido pagar al dia y no a caído en mora, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia para la elaboración de tejidos tipicos para vender.
texts.en:
PACORRAL DUO
Flavia was born in the village of Pacorral, located in the municipality of Tecpan, in Guatemala. She is 41 and is responsible for an underage daughter. She works weaving traditional weaves by hand, and raising animals.

She used the loan she received to buy more raw materials to make weaves. Sometimes, she cannot work because she does not have the materials she needs. She also bought some piglets to raise and some feed for them.

She dreams of expanding her business, which would result in better profits for her and in the improvement of the house where she lives.

She has received Kiva loans before. Thanks to God, she has been able to pay on time, without defaulting.

She is requesting this loan to buy raw materials to make traditional weaves to sell.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make traditional weaves.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Description:                                          
Rose is married and a mother of 3 children. They live in a six bedroom house in the North West Region of Cameroon. She had a difficult moment when she lost her son and sickness in her family that make her spend more, She was advised by her friends to join GHAPE in 1998 and she has taken and repaid EC eleven times.

With this new loan requested she will buy clothes and shoes and resale for profit purpose. She is confident that this business will succeed because she has been a seamstress for four years now; she has a lot of experience and many customers. She also has a good business site and two sewing machines.The community will benefit from her activity in that they will clothe themselves at a cheap price and those who don’t have time and money to go to the market will buy from her. With the profit made from this loan, she will complete their house; sponsor her off springs, children in the family at large, and poor people around her. 
She prefers a GHAPE loan because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals;members are trained in finance management before the loans are disbursed and the hospitality of members toward each other.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to resell for profit.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
This is Irine's second time borrowing, after repaying her loan successfully. 

She has requested the money to expand her green grocery shop by purchasing vegetables and fruits.

Irine hopes to educate her son and repay her loan with the profits earned.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to be successful and have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 61 years old and married with five children. She earns a living by growing coconuts in the Philippines. Nenita is borrowing 50,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizer for her coconut crop.

Nenita has been in this business for 10 years and earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizer for her coconut crop.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling dry goods in the Philippines.

She has requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of dry goods to sell. Juanita has been in this business for five years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business

In the future, Juanita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of dry goods to sell.

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell root crops business in the Philippines.

May requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional sacks of root crops to sell through her business.

May has been in this business for six years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of root crops to sell through her business.

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.en:
Dionisia is a hardworking female entrepreneur with three children.

She earns a living by farming coconut in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilzers and other farm supplies.

She supplements this income with earnings from food vending. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Dionisia dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Frenel

texts.en:
Frenel is 43 years old, married, and has two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Frenel is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Frenel has been farming rice for eight years and also earns additional income from farming coconut and from a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Angel Misael

texts.es:
Ángel, de 28 años de edad, es un hombre muy luchador, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañado y tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad.  

Ángel, se dedica a la agricultura y a la albañilería, su papá le enseño esos oficios, trabaja en la agricultura desde que tenía 15 años de edad y la albañilería lo aprendió 3 años después.

Ángel, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas para sus cultivos, porque el invierno se está normalizando y él tiene que iniciar a sembrar el maíz.  

Él sueña con obtener buenas cosechas, para poder sostener a su familia y asegurarle una vida digna a su hijo.
texts.en:
Ángel is 28 years old. He is a persistent man who studied up to the sixth grade. He is married and has a 4-year-old son.

Ángel works in agriculture and as a mason. His father taught him these activities. He has been working in agriculture since he was 15. He learned masonry three years later.

Ángel needs this loan to buy agricultural supplies for his plantations. Winter is coming, and he has to start sowing corn.

He dreams of having good harvests in order to sustain his family and make sure his son enjoys a dignified life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for his plantations.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Raquel works hard to support her family. She has a business buying and selling ready to wear items in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Raquel is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ready to wear to sell for business.

Raquel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ready to wear to sell

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a low income class person who has acquired three loans from UGAFODE which have been instrumental in helping her grow the business like buying tools and also renting a bigger stone quarry. She has applied for another loan of UGX 1,400,000. She is a married woman with children.

She is a business woman involved in stone quarrying. In a bid to increase her working capital /expand on the business, she has applied for a loan of UGX 1,500,000 to hire labour to increase her output and therefore sales and profit. The more crushed stones she has, the more the income.

She is however faced with a challenge of competition and lack of enough capital.

She is very grateful for the support UGAFODE Microfinance and Kiva lenders offered to her since she is now able to fund her business.

loans.use: to boost business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish technology studies on development of maintenance systems.

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru:
Эту женщину зовут Мухайё. Она дома занимается шитьем национальной  женской одежды на заказ. Ей удобно шить на дому. Мухайё добрая и шустрая женщина, которая хорошо справляется со своей работой. Она научилась шить и кроить женскую одежду 3 лет назад и по сей день продолжает свое любимое дело.
 Мухайё в этом году исполнилось 35 лет. Она проживает в Яване с четверыми маленькими детьми. К сожалению, её муж в настоящее время находится вдали от семьи – он на заработках в Российской Федерации, и каждый месяц отправляет им деньги. 
В швейном деле Мухайё нравится ежедневный доход и общение с новыми людьми. Она берет кредит, чтобы купить новую швейную машинку, чтобы улучшить процесс работы и приобрести много клиентов. Ее мечта - в будущем открыть свое ателье по шитью национальной женской одежды.
texts.en:
This woman is called Muhayo. She works from home sewing national women's clothing to order. Sewing at home is convenient for her. Muhayo is a kind and active woman who performs her work well. She learned to cut and sew women's clothing three years ago, and continues her favorite work to this day.

This year Muhayo turned 35 years old. She lives in Yavan with four small children. Unfortunately, at the present time her husband is far away from the family: he is away working in the Russian Federation, and sends them money each month.

What Muhayo likes about the sewing business is the daily income and communicating with new people. She is taking a loan to buy a new sewing machine in order to improve the process of her work and acquire lots of clients. Her dream is to open her own workshop sewing national women's clothing in the future.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
As a married parent of nine children, Elsie works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns income from buying and selling fish. Elsie is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fishing net, gasoline and other materials for her business.

Elsie has been sustaining her business activities through her past ten loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, gasoline and other materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Olay

texts.en:
Olay works hard to support her family. Olay is married and has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines.

Olay requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase sacks of bananas to sell.

Olay has been in this business for nine years now, and also earns additional income from farming rice .

In the future, Olay would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of bananas to sell

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena works hard to support her family. Rowena is married and has a business of bamboo weaving in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of bamboo weave.

Rowena has been in this business for six years now.

In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of bamboo weave

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell. She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like a general store.

Josephine dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anichka

texts.en: After ending her first Kiva loan, Anichka hopes that she will be able to get a second partnership with Kiva lenders and the Kiva field partner Nor Horizon. She is 29 years old and she lives in Vanadzor city, Lori region with her husband and two sons. Anichka graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute in the faculty of Methodology and Pedagogy. Now she works at the school as a teacher of elementary classes. She loves her work and she works hard to help each of her pupils to overcome any difficulties in their learning process. She also continues to give paid private courses (Armenian Language and Literature) for pupils who are working to pass entrance exams. She is known in the school and in the district as a clever and patient pedagogue. This time Anichka wants to use her Kiva loan to pay for training courses in pedagogical methodology for herself, and also she would like to furnish the room where she gives her private courses with her pupils.

loans.use: to pay for training courses of pedagogical methodology for herself, and also she would like to furnish the room where she gives her private courses with her pupils

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly is 46 years old, married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of household items to sell.

Beverly has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from fish vending. Beverly aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of household items to sell.

loans.name: Adoracion

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Adoracion works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising pigs and general store. Adoracion is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, milk, sugar, spices, vegetables, etc for her food vending business.

Adoracion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, milk, sugar, spices, vegetables, etc

loans.name: Walaa

texts.en:
Walaa, 28 years old, is a young married woman without children. She lives in one of the poorest areas in Amman. She wants to have children, but the treatments she must take are very expensive. Therefore, she decided to work in order to help her husband (who is working as a bus driver) to save the money for the needed treatment.

Walaa started making gifts boxes that she sells to shops. Now she needs to expand and further develop her work to increase her income. Therefore, she applied for a loan to buy tools and a new machine for making the boxes. The additional income will help her to improve the standard of living for her and her husband.

loans.use: to buy tools and a new machine for making gift boxes.

loans.name: Ke

texts.en:
Ke is a 63-year-old mother of eight children, a villager living in Kampong Cham province. She currently supports three of her children, two of whom are at university while the third attends high school. She grows cassava as her main source of income and earns some additional money from rice cropping. Ke has been involved with both businesses for 45 years and she can save about $4.45 USD per day from her daily income. Her main challenge this year is that the price of cassava has been dropping steadily.

This is her first loan with VisionFund. She will use a portion of the loan to pay tuition fees for her son, who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree majoring in English Literature. She hopes that her son can get a good job after graduating.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her son who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree in English Literature.

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr: Ami est une femme mariée âgée de 39 ans habitant à Adidogomé. Mère de cinq enfants, Ami prépare et vend du haricot et s’approvisionne du nécessaire pour la préparation une fois par mois au marché et le revend sous un hangar à la devanture de son domicile. Pour commander des bols du haricot, des bidons d’huile et des bols de farine de manioc, Ami sollicite ce prêt pour en faire usage.  Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Ami compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants en les inscrivant dans de bons établissements scolaire.
texts.en:
Ami, age 39, is a married mother of five who lives in Adidogomé. She sells a bean-based dish that she prepares herself. She buys her ingredients once a month at the market, and she sells her dish out of a stall set up in front of her home.

Ami is seeking this loan to purchase beans, oil and cassava flour. She plans to use her profits to improve her sales and to support her children's education by enrolling them in good schools.

loans.use: to buy 28 bowlfuls of beans, 2 jugs of oil, and 20 bowlfuls of cassava flour.

loans.name: Haqif

texts.en:
Haqif is a single young man who is very ambitious and likes to work a lot. He lives in a small village with his entire family and is their main source of income. He currently works in a restaurant kitchen as a cook and doesn't have much time to finish his studies. 

His family also keeps a cow to help cut down on expenses and get dairy products for themselves. At this time, Haqif is asking for a loan to purchase a new milk cow to be able to sell the products in his neighborhood and generate even more income for his family.

He hopes to be able to get married in the near future and to have a big family of his own. He really appreciates all of the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a new milk cow to be able to sell the products in his neighborhood and generate even more income for his family

loans.name: Abdl-Rahamn

texts.en: Abdl-Rahamn is a 23-year-old single young man from Rafah city. His father is an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low and unstable income. This income barely covers all the family needs. Abdl is a student in the university where he studies Arabic literature. He wants to take the BA degree and find a job to help his family with part of their expenses.  took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. taking this loan, Abdl will be able to do his homework and reports easily. Abdl appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia works hard to support her family. Cecelia is married and has a business buying and selling sea cucumbers in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sea cucumbers to sell.

Cecelia has been in this business for 8 years now.

In the future, Cecelia would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sea cucumbers to sell.

loans.name: Rona

texts.en: Rona is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rona is 42 years old and has two children who are still in school. Rona has run a tailoring business in the Philippines for 20 years. Rona requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials such as zippers, cloth, and thread and pay for maintenance for her tailoring machine. She would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials such as zippers, cloth, and thread and pay for maintenance for her tailoring machine.

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es: Sandra de 37 años es una comerciante residenciada en el municipio de Barranquilla y desde que tomó la iniciativa de ser empresaria independiente mejoró el nivel de vida y de su grupo familiar. En su condición de mujer separada de su cónyuge, asume la responsabilidad de la crianza de sus seis hijos menores de edad, al no contar con la compañía y el apoyo de su pareja, sus hijos han permanecido en un estilo de familia monoparental, lo que hace ser a Sandra mucho más autoexigente y permanecer en la búsqueda de oportunidades de negocio con los que brindar bienestar a su familia.  Actualmente desarrolla varias actividades entre ellas una venta de comidas en su vivienda, ofreciéndoles a sus clientes que en su gran mayoría son vecinos, amigos y transeúntes del sector desayunos, comida corriente, sancochos y picadas, así mismo aprovecha el contacto con el público y les exhibe artesanías en madera funcionales para el hogar como morteros, tablas de picar y percheros decorativos, también utensilios en plástico y productos lácteos.  Hoy en día cuenta con 10 años de experiencia y una clientela consolidada por ello está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en víveres necesarios para la preparación de comidas, nuevo surtido de artesanías, utensilios y productos lácteos, con la finalidad de promover más ventas e incrementar sus ingresos.  Su meta a futuro es tener un local y más surtido de productos.  En lo personal desea tener una vivienda.
texts.en:
Sandra is 37 years old and a business women who lives in the municipality of Barranquilla. Since she took the initiative to become an independent entrepreneur, she has been able to improve the level of wellbeing of her family. In her condition, as a women separated from her spouse, she assumed the responsibility of raising her six children who are minors. Lacking the company and support of her partner, her children have remained in a single-parent household, which makes Sandra even more self-demanding and on the search for business opportunities which will provide comfort for the family.

Currently, she is involved in various activities and among them is the sale of food from her home. She offers her customers, which are mainly neighbors, friends and pedestrians from the area, breakfast, staple foods, stews, and appetizers. Through this, she takes advantage of contact with the public and displays functional wood handicrafts for the home, such as mortars, cutting boards, and decorative hangers, as well as plastic utensils and milk products. Currently she has 10 years of experience and a consolidated customer base.

She is applying for a Kiva loan, which is the first financing she does with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in order to invest in necessary supplies to prepare food, new assortments of handicrafts, utensils and milk products. The purpose is to promote more sales and increase her income. Her future goal is to have a store with more assortments of products. In her personal life, she wants to have a house.

loans.use: to invest in supplies necessary for preparing meals, new assortment of handicrafts, utensils and dairy products.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en: Ma. Elena is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Elena is 45 years old and four of her children are still in school. Ma. Elena has a business selling rice in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. Ma. Elena has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell. She would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a Kiva borrower. He has one child. He describes himself as patient.

He operates a retail business where he sells farming goods from his farm. His primary customers are locals. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy a water pump and water pipes for irrigating his farm.

He hopes that in the future, he will send his child to the best university.

loans.use: buy a water pump and water pipes for irrigating his farm

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah is 65 years old, married, and has four children. She is in the agricultural business of raising goats in the Philippines. Deborah has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional goats to raise.

She has been raising goats for 15 years now, and has borrowed 23 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Deborah would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional goats to raise.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed. She supplements this income with earnings from selling vegetables.

Marites dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed.

loans.name: Ronelia

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Ronelia works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

Ronelia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like sugar, cooking oil, margarine, etc. for her food vending business. Ronelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like sugar, cooking oil, margarine, etc.

loans.name: Grupo Solidario Cosechando Con Amor Group

texts.es:
Grupo Solidario Cosechando Con Amor Doña Fermina  es originaria de la Aldea  Pacorral, del municipio de tecpan, ella tiene 44 años de edad, bajo su responsabilidad estan sus tres hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano y a la agricultura.
El crédito que ella recibió lo invirtió en compra de materia prima para elaborar sus tejidos típicos a mano ya que por falta de capital no puede hacer los pedidos que le hacen, también invirtió parte del dinero en agricultura
El esposo de ella trabaja como agricultor, gracias al apoyo de el y el de sus hijos ella sigue adelante con su negocio.
Ella sueña  ampliar mas su negocio ofrecer otros estilos de tejidos a sus clientes  asi ella obtendrá mejores ganancias y poder mandar a sus hijos a la escuela para un futuro mejor.
A tenido otros créditos kivas y gracias a Dios a pagado bien y no a caído en mora,Esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de tejidos tipicos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fermina is originally from the small village Pacorral, from the municipality of Tecpan. She is 44 years old. Under her responsibility are her three children who are minors. She works in making traditional fabrics by hand and is a farmer.

The loan she received was invested in buying raw materials to create traditional fabrics by hand considering that due to the lack of capital, she was not able to follow through with all her orders. She also invested part of the money in agriculture.

Her husband is a farmer. Thanks to the support of her husband and her children, she is able to get ahead in her business.

She dreams of expanding her business and offering other styles of fabrics to her customers. This way, she will be able to obtain better profits and be able to send her children to school for a better future.

She has obtained other Kiva loans and thanks to God, she has paid well and not defaulted. She is requesting this loan to buy raw material to make traditional fabrics.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make traditional fabrics for sale.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is 29 years old retail shop owner in Mariakani,Kenya and is a father of two. 

He has been in this business for five years and it has been profitable.

Justus has requested fro a loan from VisionFund Kenya which he will use to service his motorcycle and buy spare parts to replace worn out parts so as to make his motorcycle more efficient and reliable for customers.

This marks his first borrowing from VisionFund Kenya to finance his business.  

His hopes and dreams for the future is to educate his children for life and provide for his family's needs.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle and buy spare parts to replace worn out parts so as to make his motorcycle more efficient and reliable for customers

loans.name: Liên

texts.en:
Mrs Liên is 31 years old and she is married. She has been working in agriculture as a farmer for more than ten years. Liên lives in Tinh Gia district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family lives in a low-income household in the village. The income from this business is insufficient to do what she really needs in order to comfort her life.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a new toilet.

This is Liên's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution Limited Liability. She hopes that this loan could make her little dream come true.

In the future, Liên hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Agustin

texts.en:
Agustin is married with four children. She grows and harvests rice, work that she has done since before she was married. Her husband took a job in construction since it was the only way to improve their family's quality of life. Agustin gets up early to go to the fields, where she oversees her farming tenants as well as her crops.

Agustin is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizer to improve her farm. In the future, she wants to live in a nicer house and to be able to give her children the education she did not have. She is sure that she can achieve her goals with the help of these loans.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the rice field.

loans.name: Rosminda

texts.en:
Rosminda is 45 years old, married, and has five children. She is in the agricultural business of raising livestock in the Philippines. Rosminda has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional vitamins.

Rosminda has been raising livestock for four years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional vitamins.

loans.name: Caleb

texts.en:
Caleb was born in Kisii, Kenya and currently resides in Nakuru town. He is now pursuing his higher education goals of achieving a general insurance diploma through the College of Insurance. He is also employed as sales staff for a social enterprise which links clean energy suppliers with financial institutions. He has been working diligently for the last six months to reach over 250 Kenyan households and provide them with clean energy products.

One of the main products Caleb sells is the Burn Jikokoa cookstove, which is a life saving stove that reduces charcoal use by 50%, and creates 60% less smoke, thus helping people to save money and reduce smoke inhalation. He has been able to sell over 250 stoves to Kenyan households, which has resulted in extra cash flow for many families to pay school fees, pay off loans, and invest more in their businesses.

Caleb plans to use the Kiva loan to purchase more Jikokoa cookstoves to sell within the Rift valley region, and to reach an additional 500 households before the end of the year. The loan will help Caleb to raise business capital he would have been otherwise unable to raise, grow his business, and reach thousands of Kenyans. Not only will the loan benefit Caleb’s business, but it will also improve the health of thousands of Kenyans, reduce impacts on the environment, and allow families to save over $200 a year.

loans.use: To sell life saving stoves to households across Kenya

loans.name: Sophie's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 2 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée le 18 septembre 2010. Il est constitué de femmes qui entretiennent de bonnes relations, très solidaires et qui s'activent dans l'embouche et le commerce.
MARIE debout à droite de la photo et levant la main gauche est âgée de 57 ans. Elle est mariée et mère d'une fille. Elle s'active dans le commerce en collaboration avec son fils.
Avec le prêt reçu, elle va acheter des tissus du poissons séchés et du mollusque dans une région du pays et les revendre prés de sa localité. Avec les 250 000 FCFA elle achète 3 genres de tissus pour les revendre. Pour le transport des tissus elle paye 25 000 FCFA.  Avec le reste du prêt elle achète 1 baril de 100 kilogrammes de poissons séchés à 70 000 FCFA et revend le kilo à 1200 FCFA, 10 kilogrammes de mollusque à 15 000 FCFA et revend le kilo à 2 000 FCFA. 
les bénéfices récoltés vont lui servir à épargner au niveau du banc villageois, construire sa maison mais également entretenir sa famille notamment sa fille.
texts.en:
This group of 2 members is part of a Banc Villageois created September 18, 2010. It consists of women who get along well and share a strong bond of solidarity. Their activities are animal fattening and commerce.

MARIE, age 57, is the member standing on the right in the photo, raising her left hand. She is married with one child, and she conducts commercial activities with the help of her daughter.

Marie will use this loan to buy fabrics, dried fish and mollusks in a region of the country to sell locally. For 250,000 FCFA, she will buy 3 types of fabrics for resale, and she will pay 25,000 FCFA for transportation. She will use the remainder of her loan to buy one 100-kg drum of dried fish for 70,000 FCFA to sell at 1,200 FCFA per kg, and 10 kg of mollusks for 15,000 FCFA to sell at 2,000 FCFA per kg.

The profits earned through these sales will help her to bolster her savings with the Banc Villageois, to build a house, and to take care of her family, namely her daughter. .

loans.use: to buy fabrics, dried fish and mollusks.

loans.name: Galecia

texts.en: Galecia is in the hog fattening business which enables her to support her family. Previously, she became a member of Paglaum MPC and borrowed the capital she needed for her hog fattening business. She successfully saved her business proceeds and repaid her loan. She is requesting a new loan to buy additional piglets and purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and purchase bags of animal feed.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda operates a motorcycle transport business. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Every day, she earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales.

For her to continue her business, she requested a loan to pay for motorcycle spare parts and repairs. She dreams of owning motorcycle units and being able to provide for her family.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle spare parts and repairs.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 36 years old. He is married and has two children. 

His business is operating a motorcycle taxi. He has been in this business for three years earning a monthly income of thirteen thousand Kenyan Shillings.

This is his second loan with VisionFund Kenya. He will use the loan to add to the cash he has and buy a new motorcycle. He will use the profits from his expanded business to save in order to expand his motorcycle business by acquiring more motorcycles. 

His hope and dream is to have a big income flow.

loans.use: to add to the cash he has and buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.en:
Valeriana is married with eight children, four who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Valeriana is 48 years old. She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Valeriana requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net.

Valeriana has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Valeriana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.fr:
Clarisse remercie beaucoup du fond du cœur,  toutes les personnes qui l'ont donné un coup de pouce par le biais du prêt qu'elle vient de rembourser. Avec lequel, elle a pu augmenter son fonds de roulement. Son mari arrive actuellement à faire de la vente ambulante dans les grands marchés des périphéries et districts.
Cette fois-ci, elle projette d'ouvrir un autre point de vente fixe dans un grand marché de la ville avec ce nouveau crédit. Elle va embaucher quelqu'un pour le diriger. C'est une femme qui a de l'ambition, elle voudrait créer de l'emploi, aider à son tour les autres en faisant cela, c'est à dire en ouvrant d'autres points de vente. C'est son objectif.
texts.en:
From the bottom of her heart, Clarisse thanks everyone who gave her a hand up in the form of the loan she is just repaying. With that loan, she was able to grow her working capital. Her husband is now able to make itinerant sales, walking through the big markets in the city outskirts and in other districts.

This time, Clarisse is planning to open another sales outlet in a big market in town with the new loan. She is going to hire someone to run it. This is a woman who is ambitious; she wants to create jobs in her turn, that is, to help others by opening other sales outlets. That is her goal.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothing, bales of stuffed animals, and used toys.

loans.name: Josette

texts.en: Josette works hard to support her family. Josette is widowed with two children and has a buy-and-sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years. Josette has requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more nipa roofing to sell. In the future, Josette would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more nipa roofing to sell.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 54 years old, married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, chips, soft drinks, etc.

Lucia has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Lucia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, chips, soft drinks, etc

loans.name: Kenette

texts.en:
Kenette is a married woman with four children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Kenette is 34 years old.

Kenette has a business selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy more shirts, shorts, pants, dresses, and other ready-to-wear items to sell.

Kenette has been in this business for five years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more shirts, shorts, pants, dresses, and other ready-to-wear items to sell.

loans.name: Ganjina

texts.ru:
Ганчина хорошая милая девушка ,пока что не замужем. Она живет вместе с родителями, братиком и сестренкой. Ганчина работает в Университете и хорошо зарабатывает. Этим она помогает семье. Её мама очень гордиться своей умной, хорошей девочкой и рада что смогла хорошо воспитать её. 
Сейчас  её выдают замуж. И ей необходимо приобрести приданное. Также провести мероприятие и  для этого ей нужны деньги. Ганчина обратилась в Арванд за кредитом. Заранее благодарит за поддержку!!!
texts.en:
Ganjina is a good and nice girl, who is not yet married. She lives together with her parents, brothers and sisters. Ganjina works at the university and earns well. This way she helps her family. Her mother is very proud of her smart, good girl and happy that she was able to get an education.

Currently Ganjina is getting married. She needs to purchase dowry and hold a wedding party. For this she needs money. Ganjina turned to Arvand for a loan. She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to host her wedding party

loans.name: Mumin

texts.ru: Мумин 49 летный муж и отец. У него двоих детей. Сыну 23 лет и он женатый. Дочери 13 лет. Мумин вместе семьей живет в городе Исфаре. Он добрый и заботдивыйй отец. Мумин любит свою семью и ради их он гатов трудится и обеспечить семью. Мумин занимается торговлей деятельности на рынке. Он продает помидоры, огурцы, зелень, арбуз, дыня и другие фрукты. У него все получается отлично. Он 15 лет занимается  этой сфере деятельности. Ему на работе помогает сын и жена. Мумин обратился за кредитом, чтобы сохранить жизнь дочери. Ее дочка болеет и ей надо сделать оперцию. Для лечении и операции требуется не больша сумма денег, и Мумин был вынужден обратится за кредитом. Операцию сделают в городе Москве и стоить очень дорога. Мумин верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку. Вы можете помочь ему и спасти ее дочь от болезни.
texts.en:
Mumin is a 49-year-old husband and father. He has two children. His son is 23 years old and married. His daughter is 13 years old. Mumin and his family live in the city of Isfara. He is a kind and caring father. Mumin loves his family and he is prepared to work hard for their sake and provide for the family. Mumin is a trader at the market. He sells tomatoes, cucumbers, greens, watermelons, melons and other fruits. Everything is turning out well for him. He has been working in this field for 15 years. His son and wife help him work.

Mumin has applied for a loan in order to save his daughter's life. His daughter is ill and she needs an operation. The treatment and operation require a large sum of money, and Mumin has been obliged to apply for a loan. The operation will be carried out in Moscow and is very expensive. Mumin believes in you and in your support. You can help him to save his daughter from her illness.

loans.use: to pay for an operation for his daughter.

loans.name: Dúo Dulce Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Dúo Dulce Esperanza Doña Selsa es originaria de la aldea Pacorral del municipio de Tecpán, tiene 55 años de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos a mano y a la agricultura.
Gracias a Dios y al apoyo de su esposo ella sigue adelante con su negocio, ya que empezó con un negocio pequeño y ahora su a crecido.
El crédito que ella recibió lo invirtió en compra de materia prima para elaborar sus tejidos tipicos y así mismo invirtió parte del crédito en agricultura, ya que también siembra maíz, frijol, fresa y otros.
Ella sueña ampliar mas su negocio ofrecer otros estilos de tejidos a sus clientes ya que así ella obtendrá mejores ganancias y mejorar su casa donde esta viviendo.
Ella agradece a kiva por el apoyo que a recibido ya que a sido de mucha bendición en su vida, Compra de materia prima para elaboración de tejidos tipicos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Selsa is originally from the small village Pacorral, of the municipality of Tecpán. She is 55 years old. She works in making traditional woven fabrics by hand and is a farmer.

Thanks to God and to the support from her husband, she is able to get ahead with her business, considering that she began with a small business and now has grown.

The loan she received was invested in buying raw material to create her traditional woven fabrics. She also invested part of it in agriculture, considering that she also grows corn, beans, fruits and other crops.

She dreams in growing her business and offering more styles of fabrics to her customers. This way she will be able to obtain better profits and improve her house where she is living.

She is grateful for Kiva and the support she has received since it has provided her with many blessings in her life.

loans.use: to buy raw material to make traditional woven fabrics to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase certified fertilizers and seeds for planting in order to get a better harvest.

loans.name: Connielyn

texts.en:
Connielyn thanks KIVA and its supporters for their untiring support on her behalf for it has greatly helped to cover her family's daily household needs, especially her children's schooling.

Once again she would like to request a Php 10,000 loan which she will use to buy more fabric, thread, and other materials needed to sew shorts, pajamas and children's clothes. She is glad that she can continue to make ends meet and send her children to school through her earnings from her sewing business. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Connielyn dreams of having a garment business someday. She prays for her children to have good jobs when they finish school. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, thread, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Milanoi

texts.en:
Milanoi is 20 years old and is married and blessed with one child. 

For the past two years, she has sold milk. Milanoi’s business has been profitable. 

Milanoi is requesting a loan from VisionFund Kenya to purchase additional gallons of milk to sell. 

She hopes her loan will help expand her business. 

In the future, Milanoi dreams to succeed in life.

loans.use: to purchase milk to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine works hard to support her family. Josephine is single and has a business buying and selling used clothes in the Philippines, which she has run for the past 4 years. Josephine has requested a 4,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more boxes of used cloth, shirts, shorts, and shoes to sell. In the future, Josephine would like to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of used cloth, shirts, shorts, and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Ana Bautista

texts.es:
Ana, de 47 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora y con firmes deseos de superación, ha logrado mucho en su vida, pero el logro más destacado es haber crecido a sus hijos con firmes principios y hoy son personas de bien y de servicio a la sociedad, gracias al empeño que ella y su esposo pusieron en ello se logró mucho y se marco la diferencia en varios aspectos de la vida de las personas.

Ana, trabaja en los oficios domésticos desde hace 12 años que se acompañó, ahora su pareja está en otro país trabajando para ayudarles económicamente a sus hijos y a su pareja.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar insumos agrícolas y repuestos para un motor de moto, con el que su hijo mayor trabaja y del cual obtienen ingresos muy necesarios para el sustento de la familia.
texts.en:
Ana, 47 years old, is a hardworking woman with a strong desire to excel.  She has achieved a lot in her life, but the most outstanding achievement is to have raised her children with firm principles as today they are good people who serve society.  Thanks to her and her husband's efforts, they have achieved much and that has made a marked difference in various aspects of the life of these individuals.

Ana has been involved in domestic work for 12 years since she met her husband.  Now, her partner is in another country working to help her and their children financially.

 She needs the loan to purchase agricultural inputs and replacement parts for a motorcycle motor, which her older son uses for work and with which they obtain much needed income support for the family.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs and replacement parts for motorcycle motor.

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Maricar works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Maricar is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Maricar has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is 26 years old. She resides in the Muzarabani District of Zimbabwe. Sarah has been working as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching life skills education in local schools to improve the wellbeing of students by enhancing their learning environment. In addition Sarah sells clothes at a mall at a nearby flea market. She has been running this business for two years now and it has enabled her to support her family.  She has diversified to a poultry production project.With the loan that she is requesting, Sarah intends to increase the number of broiler birds that she keeps from 100 broiler birds every six weeks and intends to grow to 200 broiler birds every three weeks. This would enable her to maximize her profits and even create employment for her community.

loans.use: to purchase more broiler chicks.

loans.name: Suhrobjon

texts.ru: Сухробчон мужчина в возрасте 35 лет. Он  женат и  имеет двое прекрасных детишек. Сухробчон и его семья живут очень счастливо вместе. Он очень сильно любит свою семью и старается чтобы они жили в полном достатке. Он работает строителем на стройке и хорошо  зарабатывает. Сейчас он живет со своими родителями и братом. Теперь родители решили женить брата, но так как у них дом маленький он решил переехать. Сухроб купил участок земли на свои деньги и всей семьёй они мечтают построить небольшой, уютный домик. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд за кредитом. Заранее благодарен Арванд за поддержку!!!
texts.en:
Suhrobjon is a man of the age of 35. He is married and has two beautiful children. Suhrobjon and his family live very happily together. He loves his family very much and strives for them to live in abundance.

Suhrobjon works as a builder at a construction site and earns well. Currently he and his family live with his parentes and brother. His parents have decided to marry his brother away, and since their house is small Suhrobjon decided to move.

Suhrobjon purchased a plot of land for all his money, and the family dreams of building a small, cosy house. Therefore he turned to Arvand for a loan. He thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to purchase building materials to build a house

loans.name: Satya Laksana Group

texts.en:
The goal for every group member who receives a pig loan is to become a successful pig breeder, have enough savings, and continue the program with their own money. As the longest group receiving loans from MUK, the Satya Laksana group has been successful in reaching that goal. Eight members have found success with their pig business and continue the program with their own savings. They are very happy and are grateful for the support they have received so far. The group has changed the composition of the board. They have chosen a new Secretary. The rest of the group has decided to continue their loan until the remaining group members have reached the goal.

Now with five members left, the Satya Laksana group receives 8,000,000 IDR in total (1,600,000 IDR each). Ni Komang, 42, is a housewife who started her pig business when she was married. Ni Komang will use her portion of the loan to purchase superior piglets for fattening. She will keep them for six months. Ni Komang hopes she can sell the pigs for a high price and have enough savings to continue the business without borrowing a loan.

loans.use: to purchase superior piglets for fattening.

loans.name: Ma. Bella

texts.en:
Ma. Bella hails from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is forty-eight years old, a married woman with four grown children. She owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells items like noodles, seasonings, cooking oil, powdered soap, fabric conditioner, lotion, soft drinks and assorted dry goods. She also raises and sells hogs.

She decided to take a loan to buy stock like rice, feeds, soft drinks, and purchase piglets. These will supplement the contents of her store and also maintain the flow of her merchandise. That will improve her earnings and slowly balance her finances.

She is hoping that both her sources of income will be successful for the welfare of the whole family.

loans.use: to buy stock like rice, feeds, soft drinks, and purchase piglets.
