loans.name: Joaquin Alberto

texts.es: Joaquín es un microempresario habitante de Barranquilla y a sus 54 años de edad es un panadero con una amplia trayectoria en este campo; cuenta con 30 años ofreciendo excelentes productos a sus clientes que en su gran mayoría son tenderos del sur occidente de la ciudad en donde también reside.  Esta actividad la aprendió desde joven en compañía de su hermano mayor, quien le trasmitió sus conocimientos y le ofreció empleo como su auxiliar, experiencia que años más tarde le permitió inaugurar su propio negocio y que hasta hoy le ha proveído a su familia el sustento y bienestar necesario.  Joaquín es muy constante y responsable en su labor, a partir de las 7 a.m. se dispone a realizar sus entregas hasta las 5 p.m. de lunes a sábado, de este modo garantiza un ingreso seguro.  Su meta a futuro es adquirir más maquinaria y tecnificar su negocio sin embargo es consiente que para que esto sea posible su producción debe incrementarse, por lo que está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar más materias primas y ampliar su base de clientes. Su meta familiar es realizarle adecuaciones a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Joaquín is a micro-entrepreneur living in Barranquilla. At 54 years of age, he is a baker with extensive experience in this field. He has 30 years of experience, offering excellent products to his customers who are mainly shopkeepers from the south-west region of the city where he also lives in.

He learned this activity from a young age with his older brother who taught him and offered him employment as his assistant. Years later, this experience allowed him to open up his own business and up to now, has provided his family the necessary livelihood and well-being.

Joaquín is very consistent and responsible in his work. Starting at 7 a.m., he prepares himself to make his deliveries until 5 p.m., from Monday to Saturday. This way, he is able to guarantee a secure income.

His goal is to acquire more machinery and make his business more technical. However, he is aware that for this to happen, his production should increase. For this reason, he is applying for a Kiva loan. This is his first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which is to buy more raw materials and increase his customer base. His goal for his family is to improvements in their home.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 51 years old, married with five children.

Amelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, drinks, bread, milk, coffee, spices, shampoo, soap, sugar, etc.

Amelita has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Amelita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, drinks, bread, milk, coffee, spices, shampoo, soap, sugar, etc

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Marjorie works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture-manufacturing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Marjorie is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy wood, nails, varnish and other materials for her furniture-manufacturing business.

Marjorie has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy wood, nails, varnish and other materials for her furniture-making business.

loans.name: Liza

texts.ru: Лиза, 54 года, вдова, мать 3 детей. Образование-высшее, с 1996 года в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей большой и дружной семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 17 овец. На 1,15 Га земли она выращивает люцерну. Для содержания скота есть все условия, летом скот отгоняется на пастбище, зимой содержится в теплых сараях. Ежемесячный доход Лизы составляет около 30,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Лиза обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку корма для скота. Доходы от кредита Лиза планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса и улучшение благосостояния семьи.
texts.en:
Liza is 54 years old, a widow and the mother of three children. She has higher education. She has worked with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation since 1996, as an additional income for her large and friendly family.

Liza has two cows and 17 sheep on her farm. She grows alfalfa on 1.15 hectares of land. She has all conditions for keeping livestock. In the summer the livestock grazes on the pasture, in the winter she keeps it in a warm barn. Liza's monthly income is around 30,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Liza turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock feed. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further expanding her business and improve the family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed in order to invest in her business.

loans.name: Maminiaina Robinson Francia Anatholie

texts.fr:
Francia est une jeune femme travailleuse et très courageuse. Elle est déjà divorcée et mère d'un petit enfant pas encore scolarisé.
Elle assume seule son enfant car son ex-mari ne l'aide point. Elle dirige un magasin d'alimentation que sa mère lui a laissé. C'est sa seule source de revenu. Elle était un peu abattue quand son ex-mari l'a quitté, elle se sentait trahis et délaissée mais en ce moment, elle s'apprête à lutter et à avancer pour le bien-être de son enfant, cette situation la motive à s'épanouir dans son travail.
Le prêt va lui permettre de développer et améliorer son activité, une partie sera utilisée pour renforcer le fonds de roulement et une autre partie sera destinée à renouveler et améliorer les matériels c'est à dire dans l'investissement.
texts.en:
Francia is a courageous and hard-working young woman. She is already divorced and the mother of a child who is not yet in school.

She takes full responsibility for her child, as her ex-husband does not provide help. She manages a food store that her mother left her. This is her only source of income. She was a little disheartened when her ex-husband left her; she felt betrayed and abandoned but she is now preparing to push through and continue on for her child’s well-being. This situation is motivating her to grow through her work.

The loan will allow her to develop and improve her business. Part will be used to reinforce rolling funds and part will be used make investments by renewing and improving equipment.

loans.use: to purchase an electric oven, four bags of flour, two bags of sugar, one can of cooking oil, yeast and cake platters.

loans.name: Bobur

texts.ru: Бобур весёлый ,активный  парень в возрасте 22 года, пока что не женат. Бобур работает строителем в своём селе, а в свободное время занимается скотоводством. Бобур всегда трудится и у него  почти нету свободного время. Он постоянно ищет какую нибудь работу чтобы не сидеть без дела.   Так же Бобур хочет получить высшее образование.  С этой целью он поступил в университет. Но для оплаты договора обучение у него не хватает собственных средств. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд за кредитом. Заранее благодарен Арванд за поддержку!!!
texts.en:
Bobur is a cheerful and active guy of the age of 22. He is not yet married. Bobur works as a builder in his village, and in his free time he works with livestock breeding. Bobur is always working and hardly ahs any spare time. He is always looking for some kind of work, and does not sit idle.

Bobur would like to get a higher education. With this aim he started university. However he does not have enough own money to pay for his tuition. Therefore he turned to Arvand for a loan. He thanks Arvand in advance for the support!

loans.use: to pay for his education

loans.name: Cepaka Sari Group

texts.en:
Ni Nengah lives with only her children and one of her parents in Baturiti village, in the middle area of Bali. Her husband passed away a year ago. Her children are still in elementary school.

Ni Nengah must work hard. She also raises pigs in her yard to supplement her family’s income. She has been raising pigs for five years. Ni Nengah's daily activity is working in chicken farming.

Ni Nengah is the head of the Cepaka Sari group, which is made up of six neighbors from the same village. This is the group’s first loan with MUK. With the 3,500,000 IDR that Ni Nengah receives, she will purchase a sow for pig breeding, three piglets, and feed.

She hopes that the sow will have many piglets, which she will then be able to raise and sell. With her earnings, she plans to purchase more pigs. With the income from her pig raising, she hopes to be able to pay school fee.

loans.use: to purchase a sow for pig breeding, three piglets, and  feed.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios has been engaged in the rice retailing business for eight years. She is married and has two children. She aims to keep her rice retailing business profitable but her capital is not sufficient. With regards to this situation, she is asking for a loan of PHP 6,000 to buy seven bags of rice to sell.

Remedios believes that she can obtain greater income and improve her living conditions with her additional capital.

loans.use: to buy seven bags of rice to resell.

loans.name: Dinh

texts.en:
Mrs Dinh is 44 years old and she is married. She is an ethnic minority. She has been working in agriculture as a farmer for more than ten years. Dinh lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

Her family lives in a low-income household in the village. The market need is low in this region. The income from Dinh's business is insufficient for her to do what she really needs to in order to comfort her life.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a new toilet.

This is Dinh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution Limited Liability. She hopes that this loan could make her little dream come true.

In the future, Dinh hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find good jobs, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Samary

texts.en:
Samary is 42 years old. She is married with six children. 

She has been selling maize for the last 10 years, a business that has been profitable and she enjoys. 

She will be using the loan to purchase additional sacks of maize to sell so as to make more income to educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to build a better house for the family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of maize to sell so as to make more income to educate the children.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with eight children. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She supplements this income with earnings from raising her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. Editha dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Uba

texts.en:
Uba is married and has one child who is young to attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food .

For the past three years, she has owned a food stall business, for neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in the business.

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase a stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize flour, wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize flour, wheat flour and cooking fat oil

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru: Айгуль, 47 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. У нее средне-специальное образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду и целеустремленности Айгуль, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется земельный участок мерою 1,20 ГА собственной земли, где она выращивает пшеницу и ячмень для реализации оптовым покупателям. Также в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, лошадь и 5 овец. Ежемесячный доход Айгуль составляет 14,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 4 бычков для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Айгуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и ремонт сараев.
texts.en: Aigul is 47 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She has a vocational education, and she grows crops and rears animals for additional income for her family. Thanks to Aigul's hard work and dedication, today she has a 1.2 hectare plot of her own land where she grows wheat and barley for sale to wholesale buyers. She also has two cows, a horse and five sheep. Aigul's monthly income is 14,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her business further, she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy four bull-calves for fattening and resale. Aigul plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in further developing her business and renovating her barns.

loans.use: to buy four bull-calves for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Isabellah

texts.en:
Isabellah is 35 years old. She has five children to support and she has been in the business for the last five years, earning an income of 20,000 KES per month.

She has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to purchase more farm inputs, such as fertilizer for top-dressing her crops.

She plans to educate her children and buy a dairy cow for milk production. 

She hopes to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase more farm inputs, such as fertilizer for top-dressing her crops.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is married and a 46-year-old father of three children. He owns and operates an agriculture business growing bananas to sell. Felix has been engaged in his business for many years and he earns well from these activities. His farm is still doing well, and yet he needs financial assistance to improve it.

Recently, he took a new loan from GDMPC micro to buy fertilizer to restore farm nutrients. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from his farm to buy a vehicle for their transportation, as part of improving his family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for the banana farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of tomatoes and onions to sell to her increasing number of customers

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
Noralyn is 42 years old and married with one child. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Noralyn has been in this business for eight years and also earns additional income from farming rice. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Akou Antou

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 43 ans, Akou habite à Adidogomé et est mère de quatre enfants. Akou se bat énormément dans son commerce de poissons fumés pour subvenir à ses propres besoins et ceux de ses enfants. Akou sollicite ce crédit pour commander des cartons de poissons en vue d’avoir un stock important et gagner plus de bénéfices afin d’aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire et à leur épanouissement.
texts.en:
Married and aged 43 years old, Akou lives in Adidogomé and is the mother of four children. Akou struggles a lot in her smoked fish business to provide for her own needs and those of her children.

Akou is requesting this loan to order boxes of fish so as to have a significant stock and earn more profits, so that she can help her children in their school education and growth.

loans.use: to buy two boxes of fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy primary materials such as lumbar, plywood, paint, wood glue, nails and other inputs.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta manages a mini grocery business in their village. She is selling beverages, biscuits, noodles, and condiments. Loreta has managed the business for 15 years. She uses her profits as revolving capital to expand the business.

Loreta’s profits are still not enough to supply all the demands of her customers. Thus, she is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy groceries to sell. Loreta believes that by having the loan, she will increase her sales and income as well. She will use her earnings to provide her family needs.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell.

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.en:
Valeriana has repaid previous loans through KIVA which has really helped sustain her fish selling business. She has been able to provide for her family's basic needs and fund her children's education.

She would like to borrow 40,000 PHP to pay for several packs of dried fish. Although there was an instance that one of her sellers did not pay her, she maintains her positive outlook and trusts that she can recover from losses. She believes in better sales and better days as sure as the sun rises again.

Valeriana's dream is for her children to go college to allow them opportunities for a better future. She faithfully meets weekly with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish.

loans.name: Israel

texts.en:
Israel has operated his variety store for four years.He is a 43-year-old married man with one child. He also grows rice and corn. Israel would like to borrow 30,000 PHP to purchase grocery items and invest in opening a new shop to repair air conditioners and refrigerators.

He knows that the amount he requested will enable him to increase his sales and satisfy his customer's demand. Israel hopes that his business will grow.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items for his variety store and additional capital for refrigeration and air condition shop

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is grateful for the previous loan that was approved by Center for Community Transformation (CCT). She wants to thank all of the lenders who are continually participating in the Kiva program, since the amount they provided really became a medium for the business to have an increase in sales. Without your help, she wouldn’t know how to refill products for her variety store since she was lacking in funds needed. Indeed, you are God's answer to her prayers. Once again, she wants to thank you all dear lenders.

Analyn also owns a tricycle unit besides her variety store business. She is aiming to have a bigger variety store someday where she can offer complete products to customers and dreams of having her own jeepney (local transportation in the Philippines) also. She applied for a new loan of PHP 10,000 so she can have stocks of grocery items like toiletries, sacks of rice, bottled drinks, condiments and snacks. She is also working hard to buy another unit of tricycle. In advance, she relays again her gratitude to all the lenders who will spend time reading her story.

Analyn regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony and experiences in the business, to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy stocks of grocery items like toiletries, sacks of rice, bottled drinks, condiments and snacks.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is thanking Kiva, its supporters and CCT for their tireless support for small businesswomen like her. The loans which were granted to her were a great help to grow and sustain her ornamental business. She trusts in your continuous help for her livelihood.

Once again she would like to request a loan in the amount of PHP 19,000 loan to buy fertilizer, pots, nets, and various seedlings to grow a variety of ornamentals. Ofelia puts her best efforts to protect her farm from various insects that could damage her plants as this is her source of income to feed and send her children to school.

Editha dreams of acquiring another lot to expand her ornamental farm. She prays for good health for her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer, seeds and other materials for her ornamental-plant-growing business.

loans.name: Destiné Group

texts.fr: Zahabu est commerçante, présidente du collectif de crédits «Destiné», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un journaliste, âgée de 31 ans, mère de quatre enfants qui tous étudient. Elle est  vendeuse des souliers usagés dans un marché du centre-ville depuis 2 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 10 ballons de souliers. Elle commença son business avec capital reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite accroitre son crédit, construire une maison,  scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Zahabu is a businesswoman and president of the "Destiné" Loan Group, a client of the field partner Hekima. She is married to a journalist and is 31 years old. She has four children, all of whom are in school.

For the past two years she has been selling used shoes in the market at the center of town. She will purchase a supply of ten drums of shoes. She started her business with funds received from her husband.

She hopes to increase her credit, build a house, and feed and school her children. Finally, she would like to thank Hekima for its support of entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: to purchase a supply of 10 drums of shoes.

loans.name: Aylen Sofia

texts.es: Aylen es una emprendedora de 33 años que encontró una oportunidad de negocio al incorporarse en ventas de productos de consumo masivo por catálogo, una amiga que lleva muchos años ejerciendo esta actividad la entusiasmó y le participó de los multiplex beneficios que lograría a través de este esquema de comercialización de productos, aceptó el reto y como solamente laboraba medio tiempo, le fue posible empezar su promoción a través de la oferta del catálogo a sus amigos, conocidos y familiares.  Aylen es madre de cuatro hijos menores de edad y con la finalidad de encontrar una actividad en la que su cónyuge también pudiera generar ingresos para su familia, está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en una moto para que su cónyuge ofrezca servicio de transporte y comprará unos encargos de sus clientes entre ellos chocolates, galletas y dulce en general. Esta mujer polifacética ha ofrecido a su familia bienestar gracias a  su espíritu de superación, así mismo con esta inversión sus ingresos familiares serán mucho mayores y podrá tener un inventario suficiente para la temporada que se aproxima de amor y amistad en la que se obsequian los productos que vende. Su meta a futuro es comprar su vivienda y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Aylen is a 33 year old entrepreneur who found a business opportunity to join sales of consumer products through catalog.  A friend who has spent many years in this activity introduced her and explained the multiple benefits achieved through this product marketing method.  

She accepted the challenge and as she only works part time, she was able to start this business by offering the catalog to friends, acquaintances and relatives. 

Aylen is a mother of four young children, and in order to find an activity with which her spouse could also generate income for her family, she is requesting her first credikiva through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, which she will invest in a motorbike so that her spouse can offer shuttle services and to purchase orders from her customers which include chocolates, biscuits and sweets in general. 

This multifaceted woman has provided her family support thanks to her spirit of excellence.  In addition, with this investment their family income will be much larger and she will have sufficient inventory for the upcoming season of love and friendship in which the products she sells are given as gifts.

Her future goal is to purchase her own home and improve the quality of life of their children.

loans.use: to invest in a motorbike so her spouse can offer shuttle services and purchase orders for her customers such as chocolates, biscuits and sweets in general.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 47-years-old married woman who lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan with her spouse and five children.

Her son has run a small leather store for many years. He buys leather from butcher and sells the tanned leather in the market at high price.

He belongs to a poor family and is responsible for his children and old parents. He wants to grow his business and generate more income than in the past.

Safia has requested a Kiva loan for her son to buy more leather. He can easily generate additional income for his family.

Safia deserves Kiva support and hopes that the Kiva lenders will support her. She is very thankful to Kiva and their field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy leather.

loans.name: Gulom

texts.ru: Гулом молодой энергичный мужчина. Прекрасный муж. Заботливый сын и отец троих детей. Ему 33 года. Он живет вместе с родителями. У него среднее образование. Он работает авто-мастером. Ремонтирует машины. У него очень много клиентов. Он очень дружелюбный  и быстро находит общий язык с клиентами. В свободное время он работает таксистом. Его жена Малика милая женщина. Она очень добрая и трудолюбивая. Она занимается шитьем платьев. Кроме этого она ухаживает за скотом, откармливает с целью продать его в дальнейшем на хорошую сумму. И это принесет им дополнительный доход. У Гулома и Малики  очень дружная семья. Они делают все чтобы члены семьи жили в достатке. Сам Гулом не смог поступить в ВУЗ. Но он хочет чтоб его жена училась и дети тоже. И с этой целью он хотел купить жене ноутбук.  Но так как он недавно закончил ремонт дома у него не хватило средств для покупки ноутбука. И по этому он обратился в МДО Арванд за кредитом. На полученный кредит он купит жене ноутбук и он планирует подарить ей на день рождения.
texts.en: Gulom is an energetic young man. He is a wonderful husband, a caring son, and the father of three children. He is 33 years old. He lives with his parents. He has a secondary education. He works as a car mechanic. He repairs cars. He has very many clients. He is very friendly and quickly finds a common language with his clients. In his spare time he works as a taxi driver. His wife Malika is a sweet woman. She is very kind and hard-working. She sews dresses. Besides this she looks after the livestock, fattening them with the aim of selling them in the future for a good sum. And this brings them additional income. Gulom and Malika have a very close family. They do everything for the members of their family to have enough to live on. Gulom himself was unable to go to university, but he wants his wife to study and his children too. With this goal he would like to buy his wife a notebook computer. But since he recently completed a renovation of his house he does not have enough funds to buy the notebook, and so he has applied to MDO Arvand for a loan. He will buy his wife a notebook with the loan he receives and he plans to give it to her for her birthday.

loans.use: to buy a laptop

loans.name: Kenanga Indah Group

texts.en:
The results from the pig business give a feeling of pleasure for all the members of Kenanga Indah group, and they can make their payments on time. The Kenanga Indah group said they are grateful for all lenders, Kiva and MUK, for the support they had during the loan period.

Ni Komang, as the head, feels happy for the group she leads. Now members of the Kenanga Indah group have savings and they will use it for business capital. Ni Komang has support from her husband and she decided to propose a new loan to increase her business. The agreement from all member of the Kenanga Indah group is that they continue to receive new loans. The loans will be used for increasing the number of pigs, renovate the cages and also buy a super quality feed.

Ni Komang will use her portion of the loan to purchase super quality piglets and feed. As the head of the group, Ni Komang hopes for her group to keep cohesive and always exchanging information between other members to know the latest information about the pig business. Her main goal is to have enough savings to continue the pig business with her own money.

loans.use: to purchase super quality piglets and feed.

loans.name: Dionesio, Jr.

texts.en:
Dionesio, Jr. manages his eatery business in Poblacion, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. He mastered the business when still young as his mother ran a restaurant business before. This has been doing well supporting the needs of the family. He has local customers and also accepts catering orders for added income.

Recently, he borrowed an amount to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for his eatery business. He wants to expand his business and would be more than happy to open a small canteen at a nearby school.

loans.use: to purchase more kilos of meat and spices for his eatery business.

loans.name: Eulogio

texts.en: Eulogio learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives to start-ups. As a farmer in Eastern Looc, Plaridel, he tried his luck and borrowed a loan to jump start his rice production. After several months, he was able to return his borrowed capital. To this day, Eulogio feels he owes his good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted him with the money he used for his business. Recently, he availed a loan to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer for the next cropping season. Eulogio wishes to sustain his business and be able to supply rice in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia is 54 years old and lives in Maras, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married with three children. Delia has a fish vending business and owns a fishing boat business. She earns approximately PHP 7,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase a fishing boat for her fish selling business. Delia has been a member of PMPC for six years.

loans.use: To purchase a fishing boat for her fish selling business.

location.town: Sindangan - Maras, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Roland

texts.en: Roland operates a motorcycle transport business. He has been doing this for more than five years and is working on it to earn a profit. In working on it, he was able to pay his previous loan and send his children to school. Recently, Roland took a new loan from GDMPC to renew his driver's licenses and the registration of his motorcycle in order to operate again and be able to send his passengers safely to their designated area. He wants to improve the general living situation of his entire family in the future.

loans.use: to renew his driver's licenses and registration of his motorcycle.

location.town: Upper Langcangan, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occident

loans.name: Santos Roman

texts.es:
Santos, de 34 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y luchador que desde los 12 años de edad comenzó a trabajar la agricultura, todo lo que sabe acerca de eso su padre se lo enseño, está acompañado y tiene 2 hijos.

Santos, se dedica a la agricultura y trabaja la tierra con mucho entusiasmo cada día, todos los días  camina hacía sus parcelas donde cultiva y obtiene los frutos de la madre tierra, que le sirven para su subsistencia y alimentación familiar.

El préstamo será utilizado para comprar insumos agrícolas para la milpa, porque necesita ser abonada y preparada para que dé buenas cosechas.

Santos, pretende ser agricultor y emprendedor cosechando con esfuerzo los frutos de la tierra, los cuales son necesarios para la subsistencia de su familia.
texts.en:
Santos, 34, is a hardworking and persevering man who started working in agriculture at the age of 12. He learned everything he knows about it from his father. Santos has a companion and two children.

Santos is a farmer who works the land every day with a lot of enthusiasm. Every day he walks to his fields where he grows and harvests the fruits of Mother Earth, which serve as subsistence and nourishment for himself and his family.

He will use the loan to buy agricultural inputs for his cornfield because it needs to be fertilized and prepared so it will yield good harvests.

Santos wants to be a farmer and an entrepreneur, working hard to harvest the fruits of the land that are necessary for his family's subsistence.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for his cornfield

loans.name: Adela Isabel

texts.es: Adela es una ama de casa que reside en un barrio al sur de Barranquilla y  emprendió su propio negocio al palpar las necesidades alimentarias de los compañeros de trabajo de su cónyuge quienes laboran en un taller de pintura y latonería. Sus dotes en la cocina los cautivaron y sus comidas son solicitadas por encargos, ella prepara una variedad de recetas típicas de la Región Caribe y deleita a sus comensales con comida casera muy balanceada y nutritiva; habitualmente sus platos llevan una porción de proteína, ensalada, legumbres, arroz o algún carbohidrato  y sopas de verduras, así mismo también elabora sancochos que sirve con arroces de diferentes clases y sus víveres son seleccionados y los compra de contado en el mercado de la ciudad.  Alterno a su actividad principal aprovecha la base de clientes que tiene y les vende prendas de vestir y calzado, en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra de ropa exterior, calzado e insumos y materias primas para sus comidas.  Esta inversión incrementará su capital de trabajo y podrá mejorar sus servicios e inventarios.  Su meta a futuro es ampliar la infraestructura de su vivienda.
texts.en: Adela is a housewife and lives in a neighbourhood south of Barranquilla. She started her own business when she realised the food needs of her husband's workmates who work in a painting and body shop. They are fascinated by her qualities in the kitchen and she makes food to order. She cooks a variety of recipes from the Caribbean region and she delights her diners with balanced and nutritious home made food. Her dishes usually have a portion of protein, salad, vegetables, rice or another carbohydrate and vegetable soups. She also makes stews which she serves with different types of rice and her ingredients are chosen and bought in cash at the city market. She alternates her main activity by making the most of her client base and selling clothes and shoes. She is currently applying for her first Kiva loan, her first fund from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will invest it in buying clothes, shoes and supplies and raw produce for her dishes. This investment will increase her working capital and she will be able to improve her services and her inventory. Her future aim is to expand the infrastructure of her home.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and supplies and raw produce for making food.

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
Rano is 58 years old and lives with her family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her son newly set up a mobile phone shop near his home. He offers various types of mobiles and accessories and provides a recharge facility. He attained a list of customers very quickly.

Now he is facing a problem due to lack of availability of funds because he wants to increase his stock of mobile accessories that are very famous and costly nowadays. He just began this business recently and does not have further cash in hand to purchase the desired products for his inventory.

This is the reason Rano contacted Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan and requested a loan. With the help of a loan, he can easily purchase mobile accessories and extra recharge of various networks. In this way, he can easily attract more customers and can generate more income to cherish his family.

Rano would be very thankful to such lenders who take an active part in raising the funds for this loan.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories and extra recharge of various networks for her son's mobile phone shop.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a 42-year-old woman with four children living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a professional wood-worker; he has a lathe and manufactures and renews spare parts.

He wants to buy his own lathe so he can get maximum turnover. He has been doing this business for many years and now can handle the business by himself.

He lacks funds and Shahida is compelled to take a loan so she can help her husband.

Shahida hopes that this loan will prove to be productive for the business as well as for her family.

loans.use: to buy a lathe  for her husband's manufacturing business.

loans.name: Phany's Group

texts.en:
Phany, 54, lives with family members in a rural area of the Battambang province. She has three dependent children, two attend school. She has earned income to support her family’s living and her children by growing rice for 10 years. She sells the grocery items to get extra income.

She lacks capital to buy fertilizer to support on her farm. She leads a group of four members to apply for a new loan; this is her first loan with VisionFund. She will use her entire loan portion to buy rice seed and fertilizer to input on her farm and improve the yield. She will use the loan to earn more income, upgrade her family's living conditions, and buy school materials for her children.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mary An

texts.en:
For almost five years now, Mary An has been engaged in fishing. She sells fresh fish, crabs, and sea shells to the locals in the place where she lives. Her husband is a fisherman. They support each other to provide their family with basic needs. She has four young dependents. Her eldest child is six while the youngest is five month old.

She is asking for a loan in the amount of 5,000 PHP to buy materials like a flashlight and face mask (to use when fishing). These are tools necessary to improve her husband's catch and be able to generate more earnings. Thus, she could continue to provide her children with healthy diets and better living conditions.

In the future, Mary An hopes that she can handle her fishing business successfully for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy materials like a flashlight and face mask (to use when fishing).

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
Alberto is 53 years old and married. He has four school-aged children living with him in Poblacion 3, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Alberto is peddling a variety of fresh fish in the local community to make a living. He has been doing this job for 20 years already. The business has been able to provide approximately PHP 10,000 a month for the family.

Earlier this year, Alberto joined GDMPC to have an access to financial services. His loan application is worth PHP 40,000, which will be used to pay for labor cost of fishing boat repair and the excess money will be to purchase fresh fish supplies and in return sell to the local community. Alberto hopes to obtain enough revolving funds for the business and acquire enough resources to vend. In so doing, he can gain more income and get the chance to build up a small fish stall operated in its own place in the mini-market lane.

loans.use: to pay for labor costs of fishing boat repair and to purchase fresh fish supplies.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
En las zonas rurales del País la actividad concurrida es la agricultura de cereales, tubérculos y hortalizas  y las familias de estas zonas sufren de necesidades esenciales, sin embargo ofrecen sus importantes alimentos para la alimentación de  toda la población.
la señora Virginia una mujer de 23 años de edad, tiene 3  hijos y convive con Marcial, quienes aún no son casados pero viven juntos y luchan día a día para ofrecer a sus hijos un futuro prometedor cubriendo las necesidades básicas vivienda, alimentación, vestimentas, y educación para sus hijos. Por las condiciones que nació en una zona rural  y factores económicos solo accedió a la educación primaria sin embargo por experiencia sabe administrar su economía  ya que desde muy joven incursiono en la agricultura de diversos cultivos como ser: papa, frejol, maní y zanahoria.
En esta oportunidad la señora Virginia requiere un préstamo para la compra de semovientes (bueyes) para trabajar  con esta  yunta de bueyes en el preparado de sus terrenos agrícolas para mejorar y fortalecer su actividad de producción agrícola.
texts.en:
In rural Bolivia, one competitive sector is agriculture - growing cereals, tubers and vegetables. The families in rural areas need essential items but they sell their important food so that the rest of the country may eat.

Virginia is 23 years old and has three children. She lives with Marcial. The couple are not yet married but they live together and work hard every day in order to give their children a promising future where they have basic housing, food, clothes and an education.

Owing to having been born in a rural area and to her family's financial situation, Virginia only completed primary school. She has learned from experience, however, how to manage her finances and from a young age she started working in farming, growing crops such as potatoes, beans, peanuts and carrots.

On this occasion, Virginia needs a loan in order to buy livestock (oxen) to work with the animals in preparing her farming land. This will improve and strengthen her farming trade.

loans.use: to buy livestock (oxen) to work her land and improve farming production and thus improve the family's income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for medical treatment in order to do his job well and being to save money.

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: El Joven Rene  actualmente  vive en el Departamento de La Paz en la provincia Aroma Localidad de Patacamaya  se dedica  a la  agricultura con producción de Zanahoria y Papa  Heredo una parte de las tierras de su madre donde comenzó a trabajar  desde hace dos años, además que trabajo desde su adolescencia ayudando a su madre cuenta con la experiencia necesaria  para administrar con solvencia su negocio, solicita el préstamo para la compra de Insumos Agrícolas (Semilla, Fertilizantes, abono natural  como también para el roturado de sus tierras  solo cuenta con el apoyo de su madre ya que su padre falleció hace años atrás, desde ahí que vive solo con su madre dedicándose a la agricultura y ayudando al mantenimiento de su actividad. El joven Rene es una persona responsable y trabajadora Este préstamo será de mucha ayuda  ya que podrá  realizar la compra de Insumos agrícolas  lo que hará incrementar sus ingresos  por  la venta  de su producción.
texts.en: Rene is a young man and currently lives in the department of La Paz in the Province of Aroma in the Patacamaya area. He earns a living in farming, growing carrots and potatoes. He inherited part of his land from his mother, this is where he began to work two years ago. As well as working from his adolescence helping his mother he has the necessary experience to manage his business to make it solvent. He is asking for a loan to buy farming supplies (seeds, fertilisers and manure). He also only has the help of his mother for turning over the earth as his father died years ago. Since then he has lived alone with his mother working in farming and helping with sustaining her work. This loan will be very helpful as he will be able to buy farming supplies which will increase his income because of the sales of his produce.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies, seeds, fertilisers and manure to improve his production and family income.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is thankful for the previous loans that helped sustain her store and meet the school needs of her children. They may not be rich, but they are happy and content that their family is intact and healthy.

She would to borrow 16,000 PHP to buy canned goods, instant noodles, beverages, oil, eggs, and toiletries. Her store means a lot to her since it has been her source of income for the past two years. Although at times her store suffers because of some delinquent customers, she believes things get better as she continues to have faith in God.

She thanks you in advance for your support.

Corazon's dream is no different from all Filipina mothers, which is to see her children finish school and have a great future. Every week, she meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more quantities of grocery items to sell at retail.

loans.name: Thorn's Group

texts.en:
Thorn is a 55-year-old man with five dependent children. He lives in Battambang province. He needs to support one child to study at the university. He has worked in a grocery business for 12 years. He needs capital to buy grocery items and increase his income.

This is his second cycle with VisionFund and he successfully repaid his previous loan. His grocery store has improved gradually. Thorn is the group leader and he will spend his portion of the loan to purchase more grocery items, attract more customers, and increase the number of sales.

He hopes that he can upgrade his family's living conditions and send his child to school.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items.

loans.name: Rasoola

texts.en:
Rasoola is a 58-year-old married woman. Her financial condition is not good. She has to think many times to start any task.

Her son has just started to drive a moto rickshaw (a type of three-wheeled rickshaw that includes a motorbike). This rickshaw is being driven over local roads and for small distances. Its body is made of polyester, which is not strong enough to withstand bumpy roads.

Now the rickshaw body needs to be replaced because it rattles when driven. This is the reason he wants to buy a new body for his moto rickshaw. Rasoola has requested a loan so that her son can buy the moto rickshaw body and drive it smoothly. 

Rasoola thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a moto rickshaw body for her son's transportation services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for eye treatment

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
FOZIA is a 38-year old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has two children.

She requests a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband's tailoring services. He has sewn for many years and is an experienced tailor. His sewing machine no longer works and needs to be replaced with anew one, but he does not have sufficient cash to buy a new sewing machine.

Fozia requests a loan for her husband so that he can buy anew sewing machine.

Her family has to do hard work to generate income for the huge family; she is very thankful to Kiva and their field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her husband's tailoring services.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is married and and helps her husband to operate their own vegetable farm. They also grown corn.

Her previous loan was used to buy farm products, it was successfully repaid. Her income was used to improve their house. She took a new loan recently to purchase organic fertilizer.

She wants to expand her farm and improve the general living situation of her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a businesswoman from Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena. She is 44 years old, married, and has expertise in selling. She runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports her family.

Marilyn is a full-fledged member of PMPC and has taken several loans already. She maintains her membership in good standing without records of default.

Now she has applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Marilyn continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that she has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for her family.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities and other consumable items

location.town: Plaridel-Mansabay Alto, Lopez Jaena , Misamis Occi

loans.name: Jeremias

texts.en:
Jeremias cultivates his own land that he inherited from his parents and plants high valued crops such as cassava, corn and sweet potatoes. He accesses financial assistance from Paglaum MPC, as he signed up for membership with it.

He successfully paid his loan and rolled up the profits for the next planting season. This helps Jeremias provide for the needs of his family, including the studies of his children. Currently, he asks for a loan to pay for land preparation like plowing and harrowing. Jeremias is hoping for a good harvest this season.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation like plowing and harrowing.

loans.name: Dwighta

texts.en:
Dwighta was able to buy sacks of rice, cases of soft drinks, and other grocery items as Center for Community Transformation (CCT) was able to approve her previous loan. She wants to thank CCT and all generous lenders for helping entrepreneurs like her who need additional capital to run their businesses. Without their help, she would not be able to buy bulk quantities of products to add to her business inventory. Most of all, she wants to thank God for using people like you as channels of blessing.

She is determined to succeed in the business as she has dreams for her family and expenses that needs to be paid. She would like to have savings for their future and to step up the business. She spends her whole day managing the variety store and prays that God will send more customers so that she can earn a bigger profit. Dwighta is applying for another loan of PHP 20,000 to buy more grocery items, bottled drinks, and sacks of rice for the business.

Despite being busy managing the business, Dwighta spares time to attend her CCT group fellowship that consists of 10-15 individuals, where she can gain strength spiritually by hearing testimonies from other CCT partners, hearing God’s word, and studying the Word of God, and where she can also build social relationships with other partners and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 45-year-old woman who lives with her spouse and four children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband sells milk in the market. His customers like to buy fresh, delicious milk from him. His monthly net income is too low to meet the household needs because there are too many competitors in the market.

Due to his product's quality and low reasonable rates, many of the retailers like to buy milk from him. He wants to increase his herd and produce more milk to sell on a daily basis. But he does not have enough cash to buy a cow for his dairy farm.

Nazia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to buy a cow to produce more milk.

Nazia thanks Kiva and their field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a cow for her husband's dairy farm.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Shabana is 37 years old.  She is living with her five children and her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  Her husband has been selling fruits for many years; he uses a four-wheel manual cart for selling and, as a hawker, can easily access people who prefer to buy fruits at their doors (versus going to the market).  Due to his fruits' freshness, he has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income.  Due to his reputation, the demand for fruits has increased, and around noon his stock comes to an end.

Shabana is proud of her husband and appreciates his efforts for the family.  She is receiving this loan for her husband so that he can buy seasonal fruits in greater quantity and buy an equilibrium scale to weigh them.  She wants to save the excess profit so that she can have savings for future sudden needs and for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruits and an equilibrium scale for her husband's fruit business.

loans.name: De La Mano Con Jesus Group

texts.es: Fany es madre de tres hijos dos en etapa escolar se dedica a la venta de comida rapida como salchipapa,hamburguesas, bebidas gaseosas y otros, se dedica diariamente siete horas al negocio, en epoca de verano tambien vende raspadillas y helados.atiende a un aproximado de 20 clientes diarios el dinero que solicitó lo invertirá en la compra de productos como hamburguesas papa rocoto y más, su sueño es tener un local donde pueda vender diferentes tipos de antojitos y no esta lejos de poder lograrlo,Fany se siente muy feliz de saber que personas de todo el mundo como  Kiva la apoyan y esta segura de poder lograr sus metas trazadas y aprovechará al maximo cada ayuda recibida.
texts.en: Fany is the mother of three children, two of whom are school-aged. She works selling fast foods such as salchipapa [French fries with sausage slices], hamburgers, soft drinks and others. She works in her business for seven hours each day. During the summer season, she also sells ice cream and flavored ice. She serves approximately 20 customers a day. The funds she is requesting will be invested in buying supplies such as hamburger patties, potatoes, red peppers, and other items. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell various types of fast foods, and she is not far away from achieving this. Fany is very happy to know that people around the world are supporting her through Kiva. She is sure that she can achieve the goals she has set, and she will make maximum use of all the help she receives.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as hamburger patties, potatoes, cooking oil, and others.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a 28-year-old resident of Panay in the Philippines.  For 10 years, she has had a hog raising business to generate income to supplement the income generated by her husband.  From the little amount of 8,000 PHP that she earns monthly, she provides for her child's needs.

However, she has been a member of GDMPC since 2008, and she applies for a 24,000 PHP loan from GDMPC microfinance to purchase additional piglets for her piggery to increase her income.  Gina wants to expand her business one day.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets for her piggery.

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en: Carmela earns a living from selling goods in her retail store. At the age of 43, she is still single. For seven years, Carmela has earned well and improved the business. To add inventory capital, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC Micro Credit to buy more grocery items to sell. She hopes to have more returns in order to generate additional income for the purpose of providing the needs of her parents.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell in her store

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa has always had enthusiasm for farming.  She has cultivated their rice land in Unidos, Plaridel and has generated good earnings doing this type of work. 

Recently, she applied for a loan to pay for land and seedbed preparations.  This will ensure that the rice field is ready for planting.  Adelfa knew that she had to get things right to generate more income from this cropping season.  She is thankful that she has improved their living condition and has a conducive place for her inventories.  In the future, Adelfa hopes to buy a hauling truck to easily transport her produce.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparations.

loans.name: Tilobathon

texts.ru: Тилобатхон жительница города Исфара. Она семейная женщина. Мужу 43 года. Дочке 10 лет. Муж работает строителем. Дочка учится в средней школе. Тилобатхон 40 летняя хозяйка. Она счастливая, умная и честная женщина. Тилобатхон продвигает деятельность мамы. Ее мама раньше занималась торговлей деятельности. Тилобатхон по этой причине выбрала деятельность матери. Ей нравится свою работу. Она продает несколько видов овощей, (помидоры, огурцы, чеснок, зелень и другие). Еще она свободное время занимается шитьем женской одежды. После работы на рынке она дома берет заказ на шитье. Тилобатхон любит трудиться. Она обратилась за кредитом, чтобы расширить торговую деятельность и на часть кредита приобрести швейную машинку. Основная деятельность является торговая деятельность, потому что она больше времени проводит на рынке и доход от торговли обеспечить ее семью. Тилобатхон заранее выражает свою благодарность.
texts.en: Tilobathon is a resident of the city of Isfara. She is a married woman. Her husband is 43 years old and her daughter is 10 years old. Her husband is a construction worker. Her daughter studies in secondary school. Tilobathon is a 40-year-old homemaker. She is a happy, clever and honest woman. Tilobathon is continuing her mother's business. Her mother was previously a trader. For this reason Tilobathon has chosen her mother's business. She likes her work. She sells a few types of vegetables (tomatoes, cucumbers, garlic, greens and others). In her spare time she also sews women's clothing. After work at the market she takes sewing orders at home. Tilobathon loves to work. She has applied for a loan in order to expand her trading activity and to use part of the loan to buy a sewing machine. Her main activity is the trading business because she spends most of her time at the market and the income from trading provides for her family. Tilobathon expresses her gratitude in advance.

loans.use: to expand her trading activity and buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Leodegaria

texts.en:
Leodegaria owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells merchandise like biscuits, powdered soap, noodles, seasonings, beverages, and other basic commodities. She also engages in a dressmaking business. In addition to that, she has also a farm. She grows and sells rice. She is a 72-year-old woman with one grown child.

Leodegaria has requested a loan to buy supplies like rice and canned goods; farm supplies like fertilizers; and cloth for dressmaking. These are very vital supplies that can help improve her standard of living.

Leodegaria is determined to expand her livelihood to become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy supplies like rice and canned goods; farm supplies like fertilizers; and cloth for dressmaking.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: La señora Margarita vive en el área rural con su pareja, en calidad de casada, alcanzó a estudiar hasta el nivel primario, su vivienda es rustica de adobe con techo de teja española, que carece de algunos servicios básicos, ella es una persona trabajadora y con mucho optimismo trabajan día a día junto a su pareja para obtener ingresos económicos para el propio sustento. La señora se dedica a la agricultura,  en esta actividad lleva 19 años aproximadamente, donde produce y comercializa su producción. Lo que produce lo lleva a la venta a las ferias provinciales de la región, los productos principales que siembra son papa en mayor cantidad, haba, avena y otros en menor cantidad, generalmente para consumo propio. La señora Margarita se ve en la necesidad de solicitar el préstamo para la compra de abono orgánico (gallinaza) y semilla de papa, de esta manera poder ampliar su producción, continuar con su comercialización y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Margarita lives in a rural area with her husband. She managed to study up to elementary school. Her rustic home is made of adobe with a Spanish tile roof; she lacks some basic services.

She's a hardworking person. She and her husband work every day with great optimism to earn an income to support themselves. She has earned a living in agriculture for about 19 years, growing and selling her crop.

She takes what she grows to sell at the provincial markets in the region. Her main crops are wholesale potatoes, fava beans, and oats, as well as others in smaller quantities, usually for her own consumption.

Margarita needs to request the loan to buy organic soil amendments (hen manure) and potato seeds. That way she can expand her production, continue making sales, and be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy organic soil amendments (hen manure) and potato seeds so she can expand production, continue selling, and be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia has been in a vegetable production business for most of her lifetime. She learned the craft of vegetable growing from her farmer father. She learned about the Paglaum MPC program for women empowerment through provision of capital to start up a business, and Aurelia signed up for membership.

She made good fortune and has increased her vegetable production from time to time. She employs her neighbors in her farm. Now that she needs to head up for the planting season, she asks the cooperative for an amount to purchase bags of fertilizers and high quality seeds.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers and high quality seeds.

location.town: Sindangan - Maras, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Elibeth

texts.en:
Elibeth is from Parañaque City, Philippines. She is 38 years old. She has two children, both in the elementary level. This young entrepreneur is involved currently n different types of businesses. She cooks and sell snacks, vends fruits and manage a variety store at the same time. It’s not difficult for Elibeth to manage those businesses since she and her husband, Domingo, are working hand in hand. They’re persevering to excel and earn more from those businesses since they have two children studying in high school.

Elibeth is determined to become a successful entrepreneur for she aims to have her children finish their studies and save money for their future. This woman also has a compassionate heart for helping others. In order to make this happen, she is requesting a loan of PHP 20,000. If ever granted, she will keep some of the amount and the remaining will be used to buy grocery items and fresh fruits for her businesses.

Elibeth is consistent in attending the weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gains spiritual strength from the member’s life changing testimony, shares her own experience of God’s love, pays microfinance loans and hears God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: To buy grocery items and fresh fruits for her businesses.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Emma is 50 years old and has six children currently in school.

Emma has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Emma has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es: Juan José de 20 años, encontró la manera de ofrecer bienestar a su familia por medio de su proyecto de negocio, este emprendedor es un joven habitante de un barrio de Barranquilla que instaló una venta de comidas rápidas en el año 2014 y la atiende de miércoles a domingo, de ella obtiene el sustento para su familia; él está comprometido y es padre de una bebe de apenas tres meses de edad. Sus clientes son residentes del sector en su gran mayoría, pero poco a poco su base de clientes se está expandiendo por sus innovadoras preparaciones, en su carta maneja perros calientes, haburguesas, salchipapas, carnes y chuzos todos con su toque secreto. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en insumos y materias primas como bolsas de papas fritas, panes, verduras, carnes frías y gaseosas. Con esta inversión se fortalecerá su capital de trabajo y podrá incrementar sus ventas.  Su meta a futuro es comprar un nuevo carro de comidas y continuar ofreciendo bienestar a su familia.
texts.en: Juan José is 20 years old. He found a way to provide for the well being of his family through his business project. This young entrepreneur lives in a neighbourhood south of Barranquilla. He started a business selling fast food in 2014 and he works there from Wednesday to Sunday. From this he earns what he needs to maintain his family. He is committed and is a father to a baby that is barely three months old. His customers are mainly residents of the area, but little by little his client base is expanding because of his innovative dishes. On his menu are hot dogs, hamburgers, sausages with chips, meats and kebabs, all with a secret touch. He is currently applying for a Kiva loan, his first fund from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to invest in supplies and raw materials like bags of chips, breads, vegetables, cold meats and fizzy juices. With this investment he will strengthen his working capital and will be able to increase his sales. His future aim is to buy a new food truck and continue to provide for the well being of his family.

loans.use: to buy supplies and raw produce such as bags of chips, breads, vegetables, cold meats and fizzy drinks.

loans.name: Carmen Virgini

texts.es: Carmen tiene 50 años y está casada, ella vive en la Ciudad de México, es una mujer sumamente tenaz que siempre está en búsqueda de nuevos retos y aventuras, desde hace 10 años ella inicio un centro de reciclaje para apoyar al medio ambiente, sin embargo por azares del destino dicho negocio se convirtió en un centro de copiado e internet. El negocio que ella posee tiene mucha demanda por lo cual su principal dificultad es no poder satisfacer a todos sus clientes, con un préstamo de MXN 20,000 ella podrá comprar maquinas impresoras y así poder satisfacer la gran demanda de clientes que ella posee, su mayor sueño es posicionar muy bien su negocio a darle a sus hijas la posibilidad de estudiar en Universidades privadas y de prestigio. Ella está muy contenta por participar y está muy comprometida a ser puntual en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Carmen is 50 years old and married, she lives in Mexico City, and she is an extremely tenacious woman who is always looking for new challenges and adventures. Ten years ago she started a recycling center to support the environment; however by a twist of fate that business became an Internet and copy center.

The business she owns is in high demand, due to which her main difficulty is not being able to satisfy all her customers. With a loan of 1,200 (MXN 20,000) she can buy printers and thus be able to meet the high customer demand that she has. Her biggest dream is to get her business well-positioned to give her daughters a chance to study in private and prestigious universities. She is very happy to participate [in the loan program] and is very committed to being punctual in her payments.

loans.use: buy printers.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher is a hardworking single man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He grows tea, makes popcorn and runs a salon business that adds to his income. He started theses businesses with the hope of getting more income for his family. He is faced with the hardships of drought and price changes that make him lag behind in terms of expansion. Even though that is happening, Christopher looks forward to increasing his sources of income.Christopher needs a loan to buy tea seedlings for planting.

loans.use: to buy tea seedlings for planting

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en: Luisa has a very high interest in doing business. She has been involved in business activities since 2002, with her own working capital of $200 and she makes her best of it. She has a small store so she is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to her working capital because her capital is not enough. She will use this loan to buy additional items to keep in her store including aqua, slippers, rice, cooking oils, sweets, sardines and other things to sell, including soft drinks and hard drinks. With this loan, she still wants to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to keep in her store including aqua, slippers, rice, cooking oils, sweets, sardines and other things to sell, including soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda operates a general store to earn a profit. She helps her husband, who does fishing to provide for the needs of her family and also for the needs of her children in school.

She has been running the business for almost fifteen years; she is earning well, and her previous loan has been repaid successfully.

She took a new loan recently to buy more goods to offer to her customers in order to increase her sales. Erlinda wants to expand her store as well as improve the general living situation of her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Virgina

texts.en:
In the Philippines, there is a unique type of business called a "sari-sari" store. It is quite similar to a convenience store; however, it is a smaller version. You will see this in every barrios, barangays, or even in cities. You can find a variety (or "sari-sari" in Filipino) of items that can be bought at a cheap price since they sell the products by volume, kilos, or by piece.

One entrepreneur who is engaged in this type of business is Virginia. She is a 47-year-old CCT member who has been managing her own sari-sari store business for 5 years and she enjoys doing it. Virginia believes that CCT helps aspiring entrepreneurs in their business by granting loan requests and conducting business mentoring. Since Virginia wants to have additional capital for her business to grow and save money for their future, she decided to apply for a 30,000 PHP loan to add items for the business such as bottled drinks, sacks of rice, school supplies, and grocery items.

Despite being busy managing the business, Virginia spares time to attend a CCT group fellowship that consists of 10-15 individuals. There she can gain strength spiritually and hear testimonies from other CCT partners and is able to hear God’s word, study the Word of God, build social relationships with other partners, and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to add items for her business such as bottled drinks, sacks of rice, school supplies, and grocery items.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and supplements this income with her earnings from direct selling Avon products.

Elsie is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs. She dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George used the previous loan to pay school fees for his children. He is a mixed farmer, growing bananas and rearing cattle since 1983. He started with a vision of employing himself.

He is faced with hardships of inadequate capital that limits him in expanding his dairy farm. However, George looks forward to educating all his children up to university and looking after his farm to the required standard.

George needs a loan to pay school fees for his children in the third term.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Simao

texts.en:
Simao is a 33-year-old married father of one child. He works hard to support his family. He is a teacher, and his wife is housewife.

Although the family works very hard, it can be difficult for them to afford the cost of their daughter's education. This loan of $800 will allow Simao to help his daughter graduate from senior high school and attend university. He will use the loan to pay for tuition, textbooks, and school supplies.

In the future, Simao hopes that his children will be well-educated and knowledgeable.

loans.use: to pay for tuition, textbooks, and school supplies.

loans.name: Ronilyn

texts.en:
Ronilyn has been running her grocery store for ten years. With the income she has generated, she was able to repay her previous loan successfully. Improving her business is easier with access to GDMPC. 

Ronilyn is requesting a loan to buy additional grocery goods to increase her inventory stocks to sell to her local customers. She plans to use the profit generated with her loan to improve and expand her business and provide for the educational needs of her children when they get to college.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia operates her general store to make a living. For over ten years in running the business, she has been doing well. Her previous loan used for the business has been repaid successfully.

She took a new loan recently to buy more grocery goods to offer to her customers in order to increase her daily sales. Offering more variety of goods makes her customers loyal to her. Alicia wants to expand her store, as well as improve the general living situation of her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy more grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is thankful that there are people willing to help new entrepreneurs who are financially incapable. The previous loan of PHP 9,000 became a way to increase her daily sales. She bought grocery items for her variety store business and personal products for her direct selling business. She wants to thank all the lenders participating in the Kiva program.

Melanie dreams of expanding her business by having another variety store branch, and of supporting her children to finish college. Melanie prays that God will touch the hearts of the people who will read her story since she is once again requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of grocery items and personal products for her businesses. The remaining amount will be used as a revolving fund for her businesses.

On a weekly basis, Melanie regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy stocks of grocery items and personal products for her businesses.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is one of the members of Center for Community Transformation (CCT). She is a housewife and owns a sari-sari store. Sari-sari stores are businesses found in the Philippines. Items are cheap since products are bought by piece, kilo, or by volume. “Sari-sari” is a Filipino word which means “variant.” Filipinos patronize this type of business since most are located in neighborhoods, Barangays, and barrios. Customers do not have to go far to buy small items. 

Lydia started her business to provide another way for her family to earn income aside from the salary of her husband, Epifanio. Like other entrepreneurs, her goal is to succeed with her business to earn more profit and save money someday for the future. Lydia is requesting a 50,000 PHP loan to buy grocery items for her sari-sari store. She hopes that CCT will consider her application.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business to become a one-stop-shop. 

Lydia believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners. Meetings consist of 15 to 30 members and she is able to gain spiritual strength hearing member’s life-changing testimony, share her own experience of God’s love, pay microfinance loans, and hear God’s word conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Matilde works hard to support her family. She has a  vegetable "buy and sell" business in the Philippines and also earns income from fish vending. She is borrowing PHP 4,000 through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell to her customers.

Matilde has been sustaining her business activities through her diligent efforts. This is her first loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 45 years old, married, and has three children. She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosemarie requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins.

Rosemarie has been raising pigs for 20 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rosario works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing. Rosario is borrowing PHP 4,000 through NWTF to buy fish, chicken, pork, meat, spices and other ingredients for her food production and food vending business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.
