loans.use: to buy fish, chicken, pork, meat, spices and other ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles grows tea and he also owns a retail shop in a busy trading center. His customers, who are in his same village, describe him as a hardworking man. Charles’s business challenges include weather and price changes, both of which impact his operational returns.

Charles is requesting a loan to buy tea seedlings to plant. In the future, he hopes to educate all his children to higher levels of learning and become a leading tea farmer in his area.

loans.use: to buy tea seedlings to plant

loans.name: Azhar

texts.en: Azhar is a 44-year-old married man. He lives in the rural area of Wazirabad, Pakistan with his wife and three children. He has been running a plastic crockery store (utensils sale) for many years and he is responsible for feeding his entire family. People of the society like his plastic utensils collection a lot. Moreover he also sells general store items like shampoo, soaps, and beauty creams as well. That is the reason his current business is running well and increasing day by day. Therefore he decided to increase his current business but the main issue is insufficient amounts of products. Therefore Azhar is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan because he has to purchase more stock of a new variety of plastic crockery utensils. In this way he would be able to cope with demands. He can use the profit amount as savings to fulfill the future needs as well. Azhar is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy more plastic crockery stock for his own shop

loans.name: Odete

texts.en: Odete lives in Suai. She has been involved in business activities since 2014. She started with her own working capital of $40. She is selling donuts, pounds, and also selling children clothes. She is requesting a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She is very interested in her business, so she takes this loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy more materials such as wheat, bread powder, and other materials including children's clothes. She needs the loan from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to improve the management of her business because she hopes to open a bigger store in the future.

loans.use: to buy more materials such as wheat, bread powder, and other materials including children's clothes.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is married and lives in Carangan with her family. She has been selling snacks to make a living. She sells suman in her village and also accepts orders for any occasion, earning well for the family. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying ingredients.

To meet the current demands, she took a new loan recently to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare puto cakes for her customers' orders. She was happy to say that with this loan, rest assured, she will meet her desired income and save more for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare puto cake.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a member of the Muntinlupa, Philippines branch of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT). A mother of four children, she has managed a variety store business for 20 years. Aside from her variety store business, she also sell viands for lunch and dinner and earns approximately PHP 20,000 each month.

A variety store is known as a 'sari-sari store' in the Philippines, meaning 'variety of choices.' It is a smaller version of a convenience store. You’ll see a lot of them, if you go to the Philippines. Many patronize this kind of business since items here can be purchased by the piece or kilo and by volume, unlike in supermarkets where most products are being sold wholesale.

The businesses that she’s managing right now became a medium for her to provide for her family's daily needs and support the school expenses. She’s thankful to God for giving her those businesses as a source of income. Right now, her goal is to have more knowledge in making the business grow. She takes advantage, every time CCT conducts seminars to entrepreneurs.

As a mother, Catherine works hard for her family since she wants her business to be successful, someday. She dreams to save money and to have revolving capital, to compensate for late payments of customers. She applied for a PHP 50,000 loan. The amount will also be used to buy grocery items for her business.

On a weekly basis, Catherine regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony and experience with business, to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship, and to listen to the Word of God.

A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationships with other partners, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for her variety store business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca works hard to support her family. Rebecca is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rebecca requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods and personal care products..

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested this new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Rebecca would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods and personal care products.

loans.name: Hermelyn

texts.en:
Hermelyn is 27 years old and married with three children, two of whom are still in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Hermelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 3,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, drinks, bread, milk, coffee, spices, shampoo, soap, sugar, etc.

Hermelyn has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Hermelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, drinks, bread, milk, coffee, spices, shampoo, soap, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 49 years old and single with one child. She works hard to provide for her family, running a general store in the Philippines.

Fely requested a 4000 loan through NWTF to buy items for her store to sell, like canned goods, personal care products, drinks, bread, milk, coffee, spices, shampoo, soap, and sugar. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from e-loading.

Fely aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items for her store to sell, like canned goods, personal care products, drinks, bread, milk, coffee, spices, shampoo, soap, and sugar.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of three children, Josephine works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending and fish vending. Josephine is borrowing PHP 4,000 through NWTF to buy a fishing net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other supplies for her fishing business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat and other supplies.

loans.name: Jose Arbey

texts.en:
Tradition is really important in Colombia, especially in the countryside of Colombia, where a lot of businesses are passed through generations. This is the case of José, a married man who is 37 years old and lives in the municipality of Urrao. He inherited a business of growing fruits and vegetables from his father, and he has worked really hard to support his whole family, especially his son, who is just eight years old.

He invests much time in his business because he wants to improve his sales so his profits increase. He also wants to expand production by growing new products so that his business can last over time. He asked for a loan so he can buy some tomato seeds and fertilizer and to pay for some technical work.

José has many dreams, but the biggest one is the possibility of buying a house where his family can live a great life. He also would like to leave his business to his son so he can continue with the tradition. Help José to accomplish all his dreams; a loan will get him a lot closer.

loans.use: buy some tomato seeds and fertilizer and to pay for some technical work

loans.name: Sreymao's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Battambang province, Sreymao is 41 years old. She has three children, one of whom is studying in high school. To improve her family’s living, she grows cassava and works as a labor worker for a fee. She has been involved in her business for 10 years.

Her cassava is not growing well, because she lacked the capital to buy fertilizer to support it. This is her main challenge that she recently faced. This is the first time for Sreymao with VisionFund, and she is a leader of this group, which consists of two members.

Sreymao will spend her loan portion to buy seeds and pay for plowing fee to increase her crop yields. She hopes that her cassava can produce higher yield and earns her more income to improve her living standard.

loans.use: to buy seeds and plowing fees to grow cassava well, so that she can sell her crop yield at a higher price in order to increase her income to save for future needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bags, doors, and wooden furniture for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in skirts, pants, children's clothing and women's undergarments in order to increase her sales and her income.

loans.name: Marigen

texts.en:
Marigen grows rice also raises and sells pigs. She is 23 years old with two children ages 6 and 4 years old. Her husband is a farmer.
She lives in the town of Getafe Bohol.

She has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, pig feed and materials (like nails and galvanized metal) for pig pen renovation. This loan will help Marigen and her family expand her business. Thus, she could improve the yield of her farm and raises quality hogs.

In the future, Marigen would do her best to provide for the basic needs of her family and to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pig feed and materials for pig pen renovation.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a married father of four children. He describes himself as outgoing. He operates a business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a vibrant place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be competition. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to service his motorcycle. His business goal is to own a taxi within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo lives in Tambulig, where he earns an income through selling fish in the village.This is the kind of living he wanted to do, because he is able to send his children to school and provide for the daily needs of his family. He has been doing this for many years and this has become their main source of income.

Danilo always wants to better their situation to improve living standards for his family. Without hesitation, Danilo borrows an amount to buy new fishing nets to be able to catch more fish to sell in the market. With his access to GDMPC, his goal of improving the business will become easier.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets.

loans.name: Celestine

texts.en:
Celestine is a married woman. She has 2 children and describes herself as honest. She operates a tailoring business, where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of enough capital. 

Celestine will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to open a tailoring school within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP microfinance bank, and the previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated extra profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Marieta works hard to support her family. She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. 

Marieta is borrowing PHP 4000 through NWTF to  buy additional cloth, thread, needles, and maintenance for her tailoring business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional cloth, thread, needles, and maintenance for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.en:
Manuela is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Manuela has been in this business for 12 years. She also earns more income from a general store. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been a farmer growing tea since 1990. He has earned enough income to look after his farm. He also earns a pension as additional income. Joseph faces a challenge of price fluctuation that hinders expansion of his business and lowers his profits. Besides that, Joseph hopes to extend his farm to new areas and boost his tea plantation by applying fertilizer for high-quality tea. He has asked for the loan is to buy fertilizer for his tea plantation.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his tea plantation.

loans.name: Ika

texts.en:
Ika is 27 years old, married, and lives with his wife, two children and mother in Zugdidi district. Ika has a minibus and is experienced in trading business. He was trading food products to different villages. Ika wants to purchase a stock of laurel leaf and needs money for it.

The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 2,500 GEL. With the received credit Ika will purchase a stock of laurel leaf and will resell among different villages. This will enable him to generate income and improve the living conditions of his family.

Ika is a very hardworking man and hopes that his new business initiative will be profitable. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin to trade laurel leaf.

loans.name: Joaquim

texts.pt: O  Joaquim é casado, vive com a esposa e três filhos numa casa propria. É técnico Agro-pecuario, com o presente  empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção, nomeadamente cimento, areia, pedra e ferros. Tem sonho de desenvolver a actividade comercial, criar e vender animais como galinhas e diferentes tipos de gado.Tem como maior desafio mais financiamentos na Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Joaquim is married and lives with his wife and three children in a house he owns. He is an agricultural technician.

With this loan, he is planning to buy construction materials, such as cement, sand, stones and tools.

His dream is to develop his commercial activities, and raise and sell animals such as hens and different kinds of cattle. His biggest challenge is to receive more loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, stones and tools.

loans.name: Carlos Vladimir

texts.es: Carlos de 25 años de edad que habita en vivienda familiar junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo de 3 años. Él es un hombre trabajador que se gana la vida brindando sus servicios de repartidor de productos en una empresa, además posee un negocio de venta de huevos con el que genera sus ingresos económicos con los que brinda todo los insumos necesarios a su familia. Carlos desea incrementar sus ingresos económicos adquiriendo mayor cantidad de huevos para satisfacer con la demanda de sus ya numerosos clientes, es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: la compra de huevos., para satisfacer las exigencias de sus ya numerosos clientes.
texts.en:
Carlos, 25, lives with his life partner and his 3-year-old son. He is a hardworking man who makes a living from delivering products for a company. He also has a business selling eggs, which gives him an income that he uses to provide for his family.

Carlos wants to improve his income by buying more eggs. He wants to satisfy the demands of the many customers he now has. This is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy eggs to satisfy the demands of his many customers.

loans.use: to buy eggs and fulfill the demands of his numerous customers.

loans.name: Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es: Irene es una mujer emprendedora de 44 años de edad madre soltera de tres hijos en edad escolar,se dedica a la venta de comida en un puesto alquilado cerca a su casa cuatro horas diarias,cuenta con este negocio desde hace tres años,sus principales clientes son vecinos y amigos que la buscan por su buena sazon y sus ricos potajes,su sueño es tener su propio restaurante y no esta lejos de poder tenerlo gracias al préstamo que solicitó y a los inversionistas Kiva que la ayudan sin conocerla se siente muy contenta de que hayan personas que ayudan desinteresadamente a gente que lucha por salir adelante. Muchas Gracias que Dios los bendiga.
texts.en:
Irene is an enterprising 44-year-old single mother of three school-age children. She sells food at a rented stall near her home four hours a day; she has had this business for three years. Her main customers are neighbors and friends, who seek her out for her good seasoning and rich stews.

Her dream is to have her own restaurant, and she is not far from being able to do so, thanks to the loan that she applied for from Kiva investors who help her without knowing her. She feels very happy that there are individuals who selflessly help people who are struggling to get ahead. Thank you very much and God bless.

loans.use: buy supplies such as rice, sugar, lentils and more.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie signed up for membership with Paglaum MPC to access the needed capital to start up her vegetable farming business. She grows a variety of vegetables such as eggplant, bitter gourd, pechay, string beans, ginger and others. She primarily supplies vegetables to her local public market. It gives her a regular net income of PHP 6,500 every month.

Lanie is heading up to the next planting season and wants to purchase bags of fertilizer and compost. That's why she is asking for a loan from the cooperative.

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizers and compost

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 45-year-old married woman, and she has seven children to provide for. She has been running her general store business for many years. It is really nice to hear that she has gained more profits than what she expected to earn. She is able to send her children to school and provide for her family's needs. She wants to increase and expand her business.

She has an opportunity to borrow a loan to buy more goods to sell. She will then have a greater income for the preparation of an educational plan for her children when they go into college. Jocelyn’s plan for her future is to meet her family's daily needs and to save money for the educational needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
This is Emma, a 59-year-old variety store owner from Muntinlupa, Philippines and a member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT).

Emma chose to run a variety store business because she knows that Filipinos prefer to buy goods in a place that’s near to their home rather than wasting money for fares to go to markets. Basically, variety stores in the Philippines can be found in all barrios, barangays, municipalities, and cities, where they have grills or screens as a protection against theft. Products here are measured by volume, per kilo, or by the piece.

Emma is running the business for five years already and this really helped her sustain the needs of her family. The profit earned in the business, which is supposed to be used to buy additional products, has been used for their daily needs instead.

To add products for the business, Emma decided to apply for a PHP 50,000 loan to buy grocery items, school supplies, and other products to add to the business inventory. She dreams of expanding the business for her family.

Emma regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony and business experience and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listening to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationships with other partners, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, school supplies, and other products to add to her variety store business inventory.

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en:
Vanessa is single with one child. For the past year, she has operated business preparing food in the Philippines and she also earns additional income from selling rice.

Vanessa is requesting a 4,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients such as meat, pork, chicken meat, spices, cooking oil, and other materials for her food production business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy meat, pork, chicken, spices, cooking oil, and other ingredients

loans.name: Jelleen

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Jelleen works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish.

Jelleen is borrowing PHP 4,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers for her fish vending business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nena Patricia

texts.es: Nena tiene 31 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su esposo y su pequeño hijo de 12 años de edad al que junto a su esposo lo están sacando adelante en sus estudios porque quieren verlo triunfar en la vida. Nena es una mujer muy dedicada a su negocio es como ella obtiene sus ingresos económicos y gracias al apoyo que le brinda el esposo. Nena se dedica a la venta  de tortillas en la comunidad vende los tres tiempos, es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora tiene 2 años de dedicarse a vender tortillas. Nena desea comprar más materia prima para seguir en su negocio ya que cada día son más los clientes que tiene, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: quintales de maíz, cal, etc. Para poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Nena is 31 years old. She owns the house where she lives with her husband and her young son, who is 12 years old. She and her husband are helping him with his studies, because they want to see him succeed in life.

Nena is devoted to her business, which is her source of income. Her husband helps her too. Nena sells tortillas to her neighbors at breakfast, lunch and dinner times. She is a responsible and hardworking person who has been selling tortillas for two years.

Nena wants to buy more ingredients in order to continue with her business. She is attracting more customers every day, which is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy corn by the quintal and lime, among other ingredients, in order to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal and lime, among other things.

loans.name: Ma. Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita felt privileged to have her previous loan approved. She used it for the maintenance of her house rental business. She also wants to thank all of the lenders who participated and are still involved in the Kiva program. The business helped her provide income to her family which is why she wants to keep it well ventilated and presentable to tenants. Again, she wants to send sincerest thanks .

Lolita prays that God will continually give her family good health as it is expensive to be sick nowadays. She is persevering to earn a daily income. Aside from her house rental business, she‘s also managing her own variety store. As an entrepreneur, she aims to succeed in her chosen field and maintain good relationships to keep her patrons. She has applied for another loan amounting to PHP 30,000. She will utilize this to pay for the maintenance of her home rental.

Lolita has been consistent in attending CCT fellowship group that consist of 15 to 30 members where she hears the word of God and testimonies from partners, this made her become strong spiritually and able to depend on God on every occasion.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her rental house.

loans.name: Revelita

texts.en:
Revelita offers construction supplies within her local community. She has been involved with this kind of business for 20 years. She also had a rice field as an additional source of income.

Revelita has been grateful for her previous loans because she was able to meet all her customers' demands. Now, she would like to keep her business profitable and growing continuously. To realize her goal she is asking for a loan of 50,000 PHP. She hopes that lenders will grant her loan.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies such as cement, galvanized iron, and hollow blocks to sell.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 28 years old and is single with four children. For the past year, she has run a general store in the Philippines and she also earns an income from vending food. Vicenta works hard to provide for her family.

Vicenta is requesting a 4,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, drinks, bread, milk, coffee, spices, shampoo, soap, sugar and other products. She aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, personal care products, drinks, bread, milk, coffee, spices, shampoo, soap, and sugar

loans.name: Marie Eugenie

texts.en:
Marie Eugenie works hard to support her family. Marie Eugenie is single and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Marie Eugenie requested a 4,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat, and other materials.

Marie Eugenie has been in this business for seven years now, and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing.

In the future, Marie Eugenie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat, and other materials.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin is married, 37 years old, and has five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Jasmin requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional buckets of fish to sell.

Jasmin has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional buckets of fish to sell.

loans.name: Karla Liseth

texts.es: Karla de 23 años de edad que habita en vivienda propia en compañía de su esposo y su hijo de 1 un año de edad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que se gana la vida vendiendo ropa interior para dama de manera ambulante en los alrededores de su comunidad y que gracias a su amabilidad ha adquirido numerosos clientes a los cuales visita semanalmente quienes en agradecimiento la recomiendan  siendo así como genera sus ingresos económicos con los que ha brindado todo los insumos básicos para su hijo y para su hogar. Karla desea diversificar sus productos para poderles ofrecer una variedad de productos a sus clientes es por eso que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: variedad de ropa interior, ropa para niño y niña, calcetines, blusas., para mejorar sus ventas ofreciendo más variedad de productos a sus clientes y así poder generar mayores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Karla, 23, lives in her own house with her husband and 1-year-old son. She is an enterprising woman who makes a living selling women’s underwear as a street vendor around her community and who, thanks to her kindness, has acquired numerous customers, whom she visits weekly and who in gratitude recommend her. This is how she generates her income, with which she has provided all the basic staples for her child and for her household.

Karla wants to diversify her products to be able to offer a variety of products to her customers. It is for this that she is applying for a loan from FUSAI to invest in: a variety of underwear, clothing for boys and girls, socks, blouses, to improve her sales by offering more product variety.

loans.use: invest in a variety of underwear, clothing for boys and girls, socks, blouses, to improve her sales by offering greater product variety.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos de 76 años de edad vive solo, su vivienda es propia él es un hombre muy trabajador, él desde muy joven se dedicó a prestar sus servicios de auxiliar de enfermería para ganarse la vida y actualmente sigue dedicándose a lo mismo, pues es muy dedicado a lo que hace le importa mucho la salud de las personas y los atiende muy amablemente por estas características es muy reconocido en su lugar donde vive. Él está solicitando un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: poliducto, cables, mano de obra y focos para instalar energía eléctrica en su vivienda ya que con mucho esfuerzo ha construido su casa a lo largo de los años pero no ha logrado instalar la luz a toda la casa es por eso que el necesita el crédito espera una respuesta favorable para ver su casa terminada.
texts.en:
Santos is 76 years old and lives alone. He owns the house he lives in and is a very hard-working man. He has worked as a nursing assistant to earn a living since he was very young and continues to do so now. He is very dedicated to what he does. He cares very much about the health of his patients and he looks after them with kindness. He is well-known in the area he lives in because of these characteristics.

He is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy pipeline, cables, and light bulbs, and to pay labor costs to have electricity installed in his house. He has put a lot of effort into building his home over the years, but hasn't been able to install lights throughout the house, which is why he needs this loan. He is hoping for a positive response so that he can see that his house is finished.

loans.use: to buy pipeline, cables, and light bulbs, and to pay labor costs to have electricity installed in his house.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman, and she has two children. She describes herself as self-driven. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge as a lack of funds to expand the business. She will use this 70,000 KES loan to buy materials to improve her business. She hopes that in the future, she will live a better life.

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy materials to improve her tailoring business.

loans.name: Genda

texts.en:
Genda has been running a sari-sari (variety) store for four years now. She sells various commodities, ranging from canned goods and seasonings to pig feed, toiletries, soft drinks, and other items.

She is a 30-year-old married woman with three children, aged 11, 6, and 3. Aside from running a sari-sari (variety) store, she also engages in farming and grows rice. She also raises hogs and provides transportation like tricycles or jeeps for rent.

She avails the loan to buy assorted stocks for the store, fertilizers for the farm, and feeds for the pigs. These are very essential tools that help Genda be able to support the family's daily needs. She could slowly settle her finances and be able to manage her existing business successfully.

She hopes that she will be able to put up a piggery business to become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy assorted stocks for the store, fertilizers for the farm, and feeds for the pigs.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf used the previous loan to buy general merchandise such as rice, salt, soap and sugar to sell. He has been a retailer since 2002, selling all general merchandise items.

Yusuf is grateful to Kiva for the funds that have seen him develop his business and increase his profits. He is performing very well in his business, and is looking forward to expanding it to new areas in order to fetch more income that will enable him sustain his family and pay the loan.

Yusuf has asked for another loan to buy bread, cakes and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy  bread, cakes and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian finds pleasure in doing her farming activities. Not only that she is doing her hobby with her husband, but she earns to make a living. At the age of 55 and married with three children, she keeps herself busy to sufficiently provide for the family. She became a member of Gata Daku MPC in 2008 and she gained access to the microfinance services of the coop. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase fertilizer. In the future, Vivian wishes to improve the general living situation of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for the flower garden.

loans.name: Ana Leonilde

texts.es:
Su deseos de salir adelante es admirable porque pese a su edad y los obstáculos que ha pasado no disminuye los esfuerzos para lograr su objetivo, lo que se propone lo consigue.
Ana a sus 54 años de edad, trabaja en un almacén agropecuario, propio, con un propósito, el de dejar su negocio en un futuro a sus hijos.

Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo con el cual comprara abono, matas de café y fertilizantes.

Ayuda a esta mujer con sueños y metas por cumplir, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Her desire to get ahead is admirable because, despite her age and the obstacles she has experienced, she doesn't reduce her efforts to achieve her objective - what she sets out for she gets.

Ana, 54 years old, works at an agricultural shop, her own, with one purpose, that of leaving her business to her children in the future.

She is asking for a loan with which she will purchase manure, coffee plants and fertilizers.

Help this woman with dreams and goals to realize, come on, make a loan.

loans.use: to purchase manure, coffee plants, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ari Mpya Group

texts.en:
MWADHAN is in her early 30s and is single with two children who are still in school. She has been running a general store for four years now. She works from 08am to 10pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be MWADHAN's 20th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the general store inventory and has managed to pay back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for the support of their group. She used the profit to pay school fees, bought a plot of land, bought sofa sets, bought a TV set, a radio, repaid the loan and covered household expenses.

She will use this loan to buy the fast moving items in the store like sugar, beans, flours, rice, salt, cigarettes, sweets, etc. She dreams of expanding her store into a super market.

Mwadhan will share this loan with her loan group, ARI MPYA, which has two members who will hold each other other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the fast moving items in the store like sugar, beans, flours, rice, salt, cigarettes, sweets, etc.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be active.

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital.

She will use the Kes 70,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes.

Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: La señora Nelly Huanca Capriles está emprendiendo es su domicilio la apertura de un salón de belleza para lo cual necesita un préstamo para amoblar los ambientes en la cual desarrollara la actividad para ello necesita de un muebles peinador, sillones, letreros etc. la señora conto con una capacitación en el Instituto de Belleza Integral "LAURENT" con la mención Experta en belleza - Mano de obra calificada durante una gestión. En la cual desarrolló su capacidad de manejo de otras herramientas trabajo y nuevos peinados y cortes que la población requiere. La señora cuenta con tres hijos bajo su dependencia los cuales están estudiando con propósito de superación y así poder colaborarles a sus padres. Con este emprendimiento que la señora está realizando, se pretende mejor la calidad de vida que actual mente está llevando, con este apoyo la señora mejorara sus ingresos y podrá cubrir las necesidades que requiere tanto de ella, sus hijos y su familia.
texts.en:
Nelly Huanca Capriles is embarking in her home on the opening of a beauty salon, for which she needs a loan to furnish the rooms in which she will develop this activity. For this she needs dressing tables, chairs, signs, etc. Nelly received a training course at the Instituto de Belleza Integral [Comprehensive Beauty Institute] “LAURENT” earning a certificate of beauty expert - qualified labor, in which she developed her ability to handle other tools of the trade and new hairstyles and cuts that people ask for.

Nelly has three dependent children, who are studying for the purpose of improvement and to thus be able to help their parents. With this venture, Nelly aims to improve her current quality of life. With this support she will improve her income and she will be able to meet her own needs as well as those of her children and her family.

loans.use: furnish the rooms of her beauty salon (furniture) to in this manner generate revenues that allow her to help her family.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is thanking KIVA and its supporters and CCT for a number of loans granted to her in the past, which were a great help to sustain her farm and poultry business and enabled her to meet their household needs.

Once again she trusts that you could lend her funds in the amount of Php 30,000 loan to buy various kinds of feed to feed her chickens, ducks, goats, and a cow, so she can raise them healthy.

Due to recent typhoons that hit the country, sadly her poultry farming suffered but she maintains her faith that the sun rises again, bringing new hope and life to her poultry business. She puts her best efforts to take really good care of her animals and her farm, for these are her main source of livelihood.

Aurora dreams to sustain and grow her both her farm and poultry business. She prays for good health for her family and grandchildren. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for feed for chickens, ducks, goats, and a cow.

loans.name: Normeta

texts.en:
Normeta is 50 years old; she is married with four children.

Normeta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, drinks, bread, milk, coffee, spices, shampoo, soap, sugar, etc .

She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from a buy-and-sell personal collection.

Normeta aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, drinks, bread, milk, coffee, spices, shampoo, soap, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Leakhena's Group

texts.en:
Leakhena is 33 years old and married with two young children, living in Battambang province. Her main source of income has been from selling grocery items for five years. Moreover, she works as a laborer for others to get supplemental income for her family. A lack of working capital is the main challenge for her, because she could not afford to buy more grocery items for resale.

For Leakhena, this is her second loan cycle with VisionFund and she fully paid back her past loan successfully. With her previous loan, she was able to expand her grocery store and improve her family’s living. In a group of two, she is the group leader. Leakhena will use her new loan portion to buy grocery items to support her selling business and get more income for her family. She hopes this loan can make her family’s living have better conditions than last year.

loans.use: to buy more kinds of grocery items to attract more customers and enable her to increase the number of sales as well as her income to save for future needs.

loans.name: Joanina

texts.en: Joanina is requesting a loan of $800 to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional items such as corn, cassava, coconut, rice and other things to sell. Joanina will bring them to the market and other places where she sells. Joanina started to open her business in 2003 with her own working capital of $600. She is happy with the loan that was offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy some additional items such as corn, cassava, coconut, rice and other things to sell.

loans.name: Buseesa Farmers Group

texts.en: Jesca used the previous loan to buy produce like maize to sell. Using the profits, she managed to start up a retail shop and trades in general merchandise such as sugar, soap, salt, rice and many others. She started business in 2011 so as to earn a living. Jesca supplements her income with farming. This group loan has helped its members change their lives and take good care of their families, a fact that makes them appreciate Kiva for the funds. Jesca is married with six children at the age of 48 years. She is a very hardworking woman whose dream is educating her children to higher levels. However, lack of enough capital is her major challenge.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cooking oil, rice, salt and other things to sell.

loans.name: Hương

texts.en:
Hương is 28 years old and married.
She owns a retail business selling tapes for 5 years.

Hương lives in Quang Xuong district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
The family earns a low income from their business and it is not enough to provide basic living comforts. For example, one of the most critical needs is to have a hygienic latrine to use by the family.

For this reason, Hương is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a new latrine. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution and she hopes that this loan could fulfill her family's need to have their own latrine.

In the future, Hương hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a hygienic latrine for her family

loans.name: Anucieta

texts.en: Anucieta is a married woman. She has three children. She operates a retail business where she sells rice, sugar, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an area with high demand for the products and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals, flour, sugar and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals, flour, sugar and other items

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina Mujeres Unidas, es un grupo nuevo que se formó en la Ciudad de Sataní, integrado por 18 señoras responsables, humildes y trabajadoras.
La Sra. Nilsa forma parte de este comité, es una señora muy trabajadora, cuenta con una despensa en su propia casa donde ofrece todos los productos básicos de la canasta familiar, abastece a todas las familias de la comunidad, ya tiene una buena clientela formada con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar productos variados para surtir su despensa, como ser verduras, carne, panificados, enlatados y otros, para poder seguir con su trabajo, luchando por crecer y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The committee named “Mujeres Unidas” (United Women) is a new group that was formed in the city of Santaní. It consists of 18 responsible, humble, and hardworking women.

Sra. Nilsa, who is a member of this committee, is a hardworking woman who has a food pantry that she operates out of her home. She offers basic household products to all of the families in her community. Nilsa has established a good clientele because she has invested a great deal of effort and sacrifice.

She is requesting a loan so that she can buy various products in order to restock her food pantry such as vegetables, meats, baked goods, canned goods, and other items. This will enable her to continue her work and allow her to grow and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meats, baked goods, canned goods, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fabrics, reels of thread, bias tape, oil, and other sewing supplies to increase her production and generate a better income so that she will provide her family with a better standard of living and education.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: La señora Paulina es una persona de 63 años de edad de estado civil viuda, alcanzo a estudiar hasta la primaria, cuenta con un dependiente económico a su cargo, vive en casa propia, es de construcción rustica con material local, ubicado en la comunidad de Plano  Bajo - Tiraque, su actividad económica,  es la agrícola produce; papa, maíz, haba, quinua, todos los productos mencionados son cultivados aproximadamente en una superficie de 4 has. Los cuales cuentan con riego, ya que es aplicado por inundación. La señora es responsable en su actividad agrícola, cabe mencionar que utiliza tradicionalmente la yunta para la siembra, en ese sentido el cliente se ve con una necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para poder comprar abono orgánico (gallinaza), con la producción en el futuro, con la intención de que se mejore  sus ingresos y al mismo tiempo mejorara, una mejor vivencia familiar con su dependiente económico.
texts.en:
Paulina, 63, is a widow. She studied up through elementary school. She has one economic dependent in her care. She lives in her own house, a rustic construction made with local materials and located in the community of Plano Bajo, Tiraque.

Paulina works as a farmer. She grows potatoes, corn, fava beans, and quinoa. She grows all the crops in an area of four hectares that is irrigated by flooding. She's responsible in her farming work. It's worth mentioning that she uses the traditional yoke for planting.

In that regard she needs to request a loan so she can buy organic soil amendments (hen manure) for her future crop. Her goal is to improve her income and at the same time improve her living conditions at home with her dependent.

loans.use: to buy organic hen manure to improve her crop and her income as well as the quality of her family life

loans.name: Asmen

texts.en:
Asmen is 42 years old and single with two children.

Asmen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, drinks, bread, milk, coffee, spices, shampoo, soap, sugar, etc.

She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from food vending.

Asmen aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, drinks, bread, milk, coffee, spices, shampoo, soap, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Gaspar

texts.en: Gaspar built his home a few years ago, with his own working capital. Until now his house has been completed, but now he has plans to repair his house. He plans to put ceramics and to repaint, but his money is not enough to buy more materials to repair his house. So now he is requesting a loan of $1,500 from Tuba Rai Metin to add to his capital. Then he will use it to buy more materials like cement, sand, ceramic, cement ceramics, inks, brushes and other materials to use. He is very hopeful with this money he could finish repairing his house so that it could be seen returning for everybody.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, ceramic, cement ceramics, inks, brushes and other materials to use.

loans.name: Rosa Lidia

texts.es: Rosa de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella posee desde hace 5 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is 40 years old and lives in her own home along with her life companion. She has managed a small store from her place of residence for the past five years. Rosa has many customers because of the good prices she offers and the friendliness she demonstrates upon making a sale. With the income she earns from her sales, Rosa is able to cover some of her household expenses.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, snack foods, sweet bread, and other products. This will allow her to have more income so that she can improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, snack foods, sweet bread, and other products.

loans.name: Emitudio

texts.en:
Emitudio is 53 years old. He is single and lives in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur area.

He is a farmer and cultivates his own land for rice production business. This business gives him a monthly net income of PHP 15,000 that supplements his needs as well as the studies of his nephews and nieces.

In order to progress in his business, Emitudio requests for a loan from PMPC to pay for labor cost in the land preparation like plowing, harrowing, leveling, seed bed preparation, sowing, and also to purchase bags of fertilizers.

loans.use: to pay for labor cost in the land preparation like plowing, harrowing, leveling, seed bed preparation, sowing, and to purchase bags of fertilizers.

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en: Isidra is married and lives in Calabayan with her family. She earns a better income from her transportation business and was able to support her child's education. She also bought some home appliances from her generated income. Her previous loan was used for the maintenance of her vehicle and it was repaid successfully. To make her services more comfortable and safe, she took a new loan recently to purchase spare parts and accessories for her motorcycle and repair costs. She plans to use her profit to buy a sidecar to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for motorcycle repair.

loans.name: Ronallie

texts.en:
Ronallie works hard to support her family. She is single and has a buy-and-sell Personal Collection business in the Philippines.

Ronallie requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy more Personal Collection products like beauty soap, beauty kits, body lotion, powder and other personal care products.

Ronallie has been in this business for three years now, and also earns additional income from e-loading and a general store.

In the future, Ronallie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more Personal Collection products like beauty soap, beauty kits, body lotion, powder and other personal care products.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana lives in Atsabe and her business is printing rental. She lives near many people, so she had the idea of opening a rental for everybody so that, if they want to print a document, it would not be far away.

She opened her business a few years ago, and she is earning a good income every day because many people come to print a document in her rental, so she is very happy with her business. She started her rental in 2010 with her own working capital.

Now she is applying for a loan of $800 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business because she wants to open a bigger her rental in the future. She is taking this loan because she wants to buy printer paper, photo paper, binding paper, insulation, ink, and other materials to use. She hopes with this loan, her business can improve in the future.

loans.use: to buy printer paper, photo paper, binding paper, insulation, ink, and other materials to use.

loans.name: Martha Julia

texts.es: Doña Martha es una microempresaria emprendedora de 46 años de edad, madre soltera de dos hijos adolescentes. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, cosméticos y zapatos desde hace cuatro años, una de sus hijas le ayuda a vender para maximizar las ganancias  y mantener el negocio, doña Martha solicita por sexto ciclo el financiamiento en la institución para la compra de camisas, pantalones, sandalias, perfumes y cremas, con las ganancias del crédito anterior logro la compra de un celular.
texts.en:
Doña Martha, age 46, is an enterprising small businesswoman and a single mother of two teenagers. She has been selling clothes, cosmetics, and shoes for the past four years. One of her daughters helps with making sales in order to maximize their earnings and maintain the business.

Doña Martha is requesting her sixth loan from ADIM in order to buy shirts, trousers, sandals, perfumes, and crèmes. With the earnings that resulted from her previous loan, she was able to buy a mobile phone.

loans.use: to buy shirts, trousers, sandals, perfumes, and crèmes.

loans.name: Nany

texts.en:
Nany is 63 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like bread, canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, eggs, sugar, and other snack foods.

Nany has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for seven years and also earns an income from buy-and-sell school supplies.

Nany aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like bread, canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, eggs, sugar, and other snack foods.

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
A loan of $ 1,500 was offered to Romana to repair her house.

Romana had to build her home a few years ago, with her own working capital and her house has been completed. Now she plans to add more room, plaster and paint, but she does not have enough money to buy more materials. She is requesting a loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy more materials like cement, sand, wood, iron, ink, brushes rollers and other materials to use.

She is very happy with the loan that is offered to her from Tuba Rai Metin, because this loan can help her to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, wood, iron, ink, brushes, rollers and other materials to use to repair her house.

loans.name: Luis Ufredo

texts.es:
El señor Luis vive en el Cantón Pajan, cantón conocido por ser una zona muy ganadera de la provincia, un atractivo es el rodeo montubio que organizan en algunas épocas del año. 
Don Luis tiene 46 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene una  hija de 3 años de edad, el tiene tres hijos de otra relación pero ya son mayores de edad, su actual esposa trabaja en una cooperativa de transporte.
El señor Luis es un hombre que siempre le ha gustado ganarse la vida trabajando duramente y así a punta de esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante, el tiene un bus de transporte interprovincial en el cual labora todos los días, el además de ganarse el sustento diario de esta forma también se dedica al comercio, compra partes y repuestos de buses los mismos que luego les vende a sus compañeros de trabajo, esto en su mayoría lo realiza por encargos que le realizan sus amigos con anticipación, con esto el logra ganarse algo extra.
Este crédito es para comprar repuestos y partes de buses. Lleva más de 5 años recibiendo los créditos son muy necesarios para su negocio. Sus sueños es comprar un bus más nuevo.
texts.en:
Luis lives in the canton Pajan, which is known for being the economic driving force of the region. One of its attractions is the Montubio rodeo, organized a few times a year. 

Luis is 46 years old. He is in a common law marriage and has a three-year-old daughter from this relationship. He has three children from another relationship, but they are already of age. His current spouse works in a transport cooperative. Mr. Luis is a man who has always enjoyed working hard to earn his living and with much effort he has succeeded in getting ahead. He has a cross-provincial transport bus, which he drives every day. Apart from earning his daily income with this job, he also is a businessman. He buys and sells spare parts for buses, which he then sells to his work colleagues. In major part, he does this through direct orders placed by his friends in advance. With this, he manages to supplement his income.

This loan is to buy spare parts for buses. He has been receiving the loans for more than 5 years and he likes it because the loans are much needed for his business. His dream is to buy a newer bus.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for buses.

loans.name: Augustine,

texts.en:
Augustine is married with children. He operates a retail shop in Kasese. He has managed to use the proceeds from his shop to start dealing in the coffee business.

Ambitious man that he is, he now has intentions of buying land to construct a permanent residential house but still lacks some money to complete his installment. He will be grateful for the borrowed money not to miss out on this opportunity to purchase the land.

loans.use: To buy land to construct a permanent residential house.

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en:
Rosette used her previous loan to buy clothes to sell. She sells second hand clothes in a busy street of Fort Portal town, Western Uganda. She works there ten hours a day having started this business with the hope of raising income for her family. Her customers describe her as a hardworking lady who is aiming at improving her home and opening up another outlet in order to earn more income.

Rosette has asked for a loan to improve and renovate her home.

loans.use: to improve and renovate her home.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela is 27 years old and single with one child. Shiela works very hard to provide for her family.

Shiela runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, drinks, bread, milk, coffee, spices, shampoo, soap, sugar and etc. Shiela has been in this business for 1 year.

In the future Shiela would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, drinks, bread, milk, coffee, spices, shampoo, soap, sugar and etc

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita has built her house, but until now her house has not been completed, because she does not have enough money to buy more materials to complete her house.

Now she has a plan to complete her house. She is requesting a loan of $1,500 from Tuba Rai Metin to complete her house. She is taking this loan because she wants to buy more materials such as sand, cement, pipes, iron, wood, paint, brushes, rollers and other materials to use.

Anita is very happy with the loan that is offered to her from Tuba Rai Metin, because with this loan she can complete her house.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, pipes, iron, wood, paint, brushes, rollers and other materials to use to complete her house.

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.ru: Назокат заботливая и ответственная женщина. Она замужем и имеет детей. Назокат вместе мужем, младшем братом и  детьми проживает в районе Рудаки. Ей 29 лет. Ее муж занимается мастером по ремонту домов. Младший брат учится в университете. Сама Назокат дома предоставляет услуги шитье на заказ. Она 2.5 лет занимается шитьем. Назокат любит свою работу и ей нравится сшить. Она зарабатывает и помогает мужу обеспечить семью. Назокат решила взять кредит и оплатит за учебы младшего брата. Она не смогла копить денег для учебы, потому что у нее есть расходы на продукт питание и другое. Назокат по этой причине обратилась к Вам за кредитом. Вы можете помочь ей, оплатит за учебы младшего брата.
texts.en: Nazokat is a caring and responsible woman. She is married and has children. Nazokat and her husband, younger brother and children live in the Rudaki area. She is 29 years old. Her husband renovates houses. Her younger brother studies at university. Nazokat herself provides sewing services to order from home. She has been sewing for 2.5 years. Nazokat loves her work and she enjoys sewing. She earns money and helps her husband to provide for the family. Nazokat has decided to take a loan and pay for her younger brother's tuition. She has not been able to save up for the tuition because she has expenses for food and other things. For this reason Nazokat has turned to you for a loan. You can help her to pay for her younger brother's tuition.

loans.use: to pay for her younger brother's university tuition.

loans.name: Mekar Sandat Group

texts.en:
The main goal of all pig farmers' groups is to be successful and independent in terms of capital. Mekar Sandat group has undergone several periods of repayment of the loan. As a group that not only received venture capital, but also received training, it is attracting some women to join. They want to develop a pig raising business and quality of life.

As a leader, Ni Komang successfully manages the pigs and leads the Mekar Sandat group. With the new loan, she will buy piglets and feed.

The loan is also used to support other businesses such as shops, services and other businesses that could support the family income. Ni Komang and all members of Mekar Sandat group hope to become successful pig farmers and self-sufficient in terms of capital.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She has been operating her sari-sari store for more than 10 years now. She sells items like noodles, canned goods, beverages, soft drinks, eggs, fabric conditioner, mosquito repellent and beverages.

She is asking for a loan to purchase school supplies like notebooks, intermediate pads (notepaper) and soft drinks. These will help maintain her store's stock be able to cater to the needs of her customers. Thus, she could continue provide for the needs of her children. She is a mother of three children ages 14, 12 and 6 years old.

She is grateful for the funds to be able to expand her livelihood to become sustainable in the coming years.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies like notebooks, intermediate pads and soft drinks.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a married woman with 2 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in an area with a high demand for her products. Her primary customers are locals.

Salome describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 58 years old and married with four children. One child is still in school. Elena works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, drinks, bread, milk, coffee, spices, shampoo, soap, sugar, etc .

Elena has been in this business for 15 years. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, drinks, bread, milk, coffee, spices, shampoo, soap, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
Marichu is a married woman with three children, of whom two are presently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who is 33 years old.

She has a buy-and-sell frozen foods business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more frozen foods to sell to her customers.

Marichu has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods to sell to her customers

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a hardworking, married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She used her previous loan to buy manure and seedlings for her farm. Apart from her own five biological children she takes care of an extra relative who serves as a house helper.

Christine is still committed to her crop farming practice where she grows coffee, bananas, beans, soya peas, maize and other cereals to earn income. Given the nature of where she lives, she thinks it's better to have diversified sources of income, that’s why she also runs a local hotel and rears cattle to get extra income. She works six days out of every week and has been a farmer for 20 years. She has served her community with food which she sells at subsidized prices.

Though she works with her husband, the responsibility of paying school fees for her children and catering for her family's other needs all rests on her. So she desires to have a big modern farm and educate all her children but is limited by bad weather and inadequate capital to hire labor for her farm and buy herbicides for the gardens. Christine is requesting a loan to buy mulch and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.use: to buy mulch and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Mfano Group

texts.en:
Salima is in her late thirties, and she is single with two children still in school. She has been a food vendor for five years now. She woks from 4:00 am to 11:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Salima's 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to continue increasing her food stock and she has repaid all of her loans successfully.

She is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for their support. She used the profits to build a one-room house and to buy a TV set, a radio, a cupboard, a sofa set and a fridge, as well as to repay the loan and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to start selling soft drinks and to increase her stock of mamalishe. She dreams of buying a plot and building a big house.

Salima will share this loan with her loan group Mfano, which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to start selling soft drinks and to increase her stock of mamalishe.

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es:
El camino que lleva a cierta comunidad veracruzana ofrece una vista reconfortante para cualquier viajero. Muchos se inspiran con el canto de las aves o el silbido del viento y otros tantos se relajan al observar el movimiento de los árboles que rodean el sendero. Los integrantes del grupo Sol Naciente provienen de dicha localidad y eligieron tal nombre ya que a todos les encanta ver salir el sol por las mañanas. Ellos son: Dulce, María y América quienes venden comida; Teresa y Cristal, abarrotes; Guadalupe, ropa; Ana, calzado; Mireya, jugos y fruta. Mientras que Juan es criador de cerdos. 
   Con nueve años al mando de una tienda de abarrotes, Tere, como es mejor conocida Doña Teresa, ha formado un vínculo con sus clientes quienes día a día hacen que prospere su negocio. La clave de dicho éxito es gracias a los precios accesibles, el amplio surtido en productos y ante todo a la atención ofrecida. En un inicio no había quien ofreciera este servicio y los lugareños tenían que viajar varios kilómetros para conseguir algún producto. 
   Para doña Tere los préstamos han impactado favorablemente a su negocio ya que lo pudo acondicionar y ampliar, Las ganancias, por su parte, contribuyen a mejorar su calidad de vida y brindar educación a sus hijos. Por lo anterior planea invertir el nuevo préstamo en la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, sopa, mayonesa, saborizante, leche, atún, sardina, detergente, papel higiénico y en la compra de uniformes escolares. “Gracias a todos los que confían en nosotros pues gradualmente podemos hacer realidad nuestros sueños, pues se puede esperar a que llegue el sueño o bien trabajar duro para hacerlo realidad” comentó.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el municipio llamado “La novia del sol”, Doña Tere viste blusa roja y está sentada sobre un pozo.
texts.en:
The road that leads to a certain community in Veracruz offers a comforting view to any traveler. Many are inspired by the songs of the birds or the whistling of the wind. Others relax watching the sway of the trees that surround the path. The members of the "Sol Naciente" group come from this place and chose their name as they all love to see the sun rising in the morning. They are: Dulce, María and América who sell food; Teresa and Cristal sell groceries; Guadalupe clothing; Ana, footwear; Mireya sells juices and fruit while Juan raises pigs.

With nine years operating a grocery store Tere, as Teresa is better known as, has formed a relationship with with her clients which day by day makes her business prosper. The key to her success is thanks to her accessible prices, the good range of products and above all the service that is offered. Before she started there was no one offering this service and the locals had to travel a number of kilometers to buy anything.

For Tere the loans have had a favorable impact on her business which she has been able to modify and expand. As for the profits, they have contributed to improving her quality of living and provide education for her children. For this reason she plans to invest the new loan in buying rice, sugar, oil, soup. mayonnaise, flavoring, milk, tuna, sardines, detergent, toilet paper and the purchase of school uniforms. "Thanks to everyone who has confidence in us as gradually we can make our dreams a reality, as you can wait for the dream to arrive or you can work hard to make it happen'" she commented.

*The photograph was taken at the town hall called “La novia del sol” (The sun's girlfriend). Tere is wearing a red blouse standing on the well.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, soup, mayonnaise, flavorings, milk, tuna, sardines, detergent and toilet paper.

loans.name: Ma. Glaiza

texts.en:
Ma. Glaiza is married to a fisherman. She sells fresh fish to the community where she lives. She is 25 years old and a mother of a six-month old child. She has been engaged in selling fish for three years now.

Together with her family, she lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She would like to expand her livelihood by enabling resources needed to improve the catch of her husband.

She is asking for a loan to buy materials for motorboat renovation like nails, paint, and plywood. This could help ease transporting the daily catch and generate higher earnings as well.

She is determined that she will improve her source of income to support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy materials for motorboat renovation like nails, paint, and plywood.

loans.name: Divine Grace

texts.en:
Divine Grace owns and operates a food-selling business in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for five years and is earning well to sustain their living.

With her revenue, her previous loan used for the business was successfully repaid. Improving the business becomes easier with her access to GDMPC. Recently, she took a new loan to buy more ingredients for a new menu to sell so that she can increase her income that can help their daily needs.

She plans to accept catering services in order to gain more revenue. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for a new menu to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca has received and fully repaid a number of loans in the past and is thankful that it has helped sustain her grocery store and direct selling of personal products. She is able to send her children to school and meet the family's daily living expenses.

Now that it is school time in the Philippines, there are more orders of her personal products. In this regard she needs funds to pay for products such as footwear, underwear, body powder, soap, cosmetics, and towels. She thanks Kiva and its supporters for supporting her in her livelihood especially now that her husband has no regular job.

Rebecca prays to have more customers and for her husband to have a stable job. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for beauty and skin products, underwear, and towels to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for eye treatment.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy bags of coffee to sell. He owns a young coffee garden; that’s why he also buys coffee to top up his coffee to sell.

However, he also grows other food crops like bananas and maize to complement his earnings. He works for six days per week. He proves to be responsible and has a developed family with steady sources of side income.

He hopes to expand his business into a large store, have children, educate them, and generally have an informed standard family. But, at the moment, his main challenges are price fluctuations of coffee produce and bad debtors in his business, which have limited him from achieving his dream.

He needs money to buy more bags of coffee to sell.

loans.use: to buy more bags of coffee to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es: Blanca tiene 52 años de edad es madre soltera habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su hijo mayor por lo que siente orgullosa de su hijo porque él lleva el sustento al hogar. Blanca se dedica a la venta de pescado y venta de ropa por lo que ella también ayuda en los gastos y es por medio de este negocio es como ella obtiene sus ingresos económicos. Blanca desea comprar más mercadería para seguir en su negocio para así seguir manteniendo su fuente de ingresos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: más pescado y ropa como falda, pantalones, blusas, camisetas y así aumentar sus ganancias y tener más variedad para sus clientes.
texts.en:
Blanca, 52, is a single mother. She lives in her own house with her older son. For this, she feels proud of her son because he brings home the sustenance. Blanca makes a living selling fish and clothing by which she also helps with the expenses and it is by means of this business that she obtains her economic income.

Blanca wishes to buy more merchandise to continue her business so as to continue maintaining her source of income. For this reason, she is requesting a FUSAI loan to invest in more fish and clothing such as skirts, pants, blouses. and T-shirts, and in this way increase her earnings and have more variety for her customers.

loans.use: to invest in more fish and clothing such as skirts, pants, blouses, and T-shirts, and thus increase her earnings and have more variety for her customers.

loans.name: Raymond

texts.en:
Raymond is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be humble.

He operates a retail business where he sells Agrovet products. He has been involved in this business for nine years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be changes in seasons.

He will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy more stock of Agrovet products.

He hopes that in the future, he will be prosperous. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of Agrovet products.

loans.name: Florinda

texts.en:
Florinda is a 57-year-old woman from Baybay, Leyte. She is married with eight adult children. Her husband works hard as a farmer, while Florinda is doing the hog-raising business to get extra income. She has been doing this for almost seven years.

Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets and feed to help her increase their livelihood.

In the future, Florinda wishes to have a good harvest in their farming business and perhaps own a farm that would serve as their main source of income.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco is a farmer from Baybay, Leyte. He is a married man and has four young children, ages 15, 14, 10, and 6 years old.

To have additional income, he is engaged in raising pigs. He has been doing this for almost 15 years. Francisco is requesting an amount of PHP 2,000 to buy feed for his pigs.

In the future, he wishes to increase his hog-raising business for his family. Perhaps, he wants to have a better means of living.

loans.use: to buy feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is a 45-year-old married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has three dependents ages 10, 14 and 19.
