Josephine has been in the business of buying and selling of coconut wine and raising hogs. She started this business in 2011, earning her 3,500 PHP per month. She plans to start raising chickens too. Josephine is requesting a loan to buy feed and supplements for the hogs, chicks to start raising chicken and rice for family consumption. In the future, Josephine would like to expand her business so she can support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy feed, supplements, rice for consumption and chicks to raise.

loans.name: San Jorge Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Jorge  está en su ciclo número 5to Del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde 14 integrantes se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir en una pobreza extrema, luchando por crecer y mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Juana que está haciendo un trabajo continuo y permanente, ella vende ropas de todo tipo, y pone su empeño en poder crecer y mejorar en lo que viene haciendo. Ella se unió a este grupo para poder trabajar y mejorar en su pequeño emprendimiento.
La Sra. Juana solicita de este préstamo para la compra de prendas variadas para la venta, como ser remeras, camisas, pantalones, blusas y otros, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The group named “San Jorge” is in its fifth loan cycle as part of the Women’s Committee Program. All of the members have also taken the poverty elimination survey, which indicated that 14 of the members are below the poverty line. This means that they are in extreme poverty, so they must strive to grow and improve.

One of the members is Sra. Juana, who works continually and on a permanent basis by selling all types of clothes. She puts her effort into growing and improving in the same manner she always done. Juana joined this group so that she can work to improve her small her business.

Sra. Juana is requesting a loan in order to buy various types of clothes to sell such as T-shirts, shirts, trousers, blouses, and other items. This will help to solidify her business plan, which will help to improve her earnings.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, shirts, trousers, blouses, and other items.

loans.name: Ursula

texts.en: Ursula is 36 years old with three children ages eight, eleven and thirteen. She lives in Talibon, Bohol. Ursula and her husband work hard to provide for their kids.Ursula's husband does fishing to support them while she attends to her Sari-sari store to help him. Ursula is asking for a loan to buy nylon, fishing weights and fuel for her husband's fishing needs. In the future, Ursula is planning to make improvements to her inventory to expand her business. Her income will go towards her children’s education, healthy meals, savings and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy nylon, fishing weights and fuel.

loans.name: Analice

texts.en: Growing various vegetables and spices in Mahayag, Zamboanga del Sur, has been Analice's source of income. She is supported by Paglaum MPC and has been able to sustain her gardening activities for a longer period of time. Analice has managed to save the proceeds of her business for future emergencies and continuously takes out loans to purchase gardening materials, seeds and fertilizers. She's gaining a good harvest and wishes to buy neighboring land for expansion.

loans.use: to purchase gardening materials, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Ana Edith

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su esposo, en busca de mejores condiciones de vida, inicio a vender accesorios como: pulseras, anillos, aretes, etc., de palta, bronce y otro tipo de enchape, prendas de vestir y cosméticos, cuando apoyaba a sus hermanas a comercializar productos similares adquirió experiencia y posteriormente se independizo.
Requiere de un crédito para poder comprar al contado joyería de enchape, lociones, cosméticos y ropa, con ello tendrá la facilidad de atender las demandas que sus clientes hagan, considera que sí sus ventas se mantienen y mejoran, tendrá buenas ganancias con las que cubrirá el pago de la deuda y gastos de su hogar.
Sus proyectos son trabajar con capital propio, tener un negocio más amplio y hacer mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her husband. In pursuit of better living conditions, she started selling accessories (such as bracelets, rings, earrings, etc. plated with silver, bronze, and other metals), clothing, and cosmetics. She gained experience when she used to help her sisters sell similar products, and then she became independent.

She needs a loan in order to make a cash purchase of plated jewelry, lotions, cosmetics, and clothing. With it, she will more easily tend to her customers' demands. She judges that if she maintains and improves her sales, she will have good earnings with which she will cover the loan payments and her household expenses.

Her plans are to work with her own capital, to have a larger business, and to make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to make a cash purchase of plated jewelry, lotions, cosmetics, and clothing

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita has plans to renovate her house. Since it's her first home, it is built with woven fiber and now she wants to make walls. Since she doesn't have enough money to buy the materials to build her house, she is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin. Rita will use the loan to buy more materials such as stone, sand, wood, cement, iron, nails, bricks, etc. She is very happy with the loan offered to her by Tuba Rai Metin because she can build her house.

loans.use: to buy stone, sand, wood, cement, iron, nails, bricks and other materials to build her house.

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es:
Feliciana es una persona muy sacrificada que esta esforzándose para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos, comenta que anteriormente también vendía todo tipo de productos, y con el préstamo que retiró anteriormente pudo mejorar bastante.
Hoy pide este préstamo para poder comprar un moto carro usado para poder seguir con su trabajo de venta de frutas y ropas como lo viene haciendo, luchando por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Feliciana is a very self-sacrificing person, who is making an effort to improve the living conditions of herself and her loved ones. She says that, in the past, she also sold all kinds of products, and with the loan she previously withdrew, she was able to improve quite a lot.

Today she is requesting this loan to be able to buy a used car, in order to continue with her work selling fuit and clothes, fighting to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a used car

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is married and has four children. She describes herself to be honest. For the past four years, Alice has operated a beauty salon. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are ladies. Alice will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy beauty products for salon use. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank; her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for salon use

loans.name: Virgen De Los Remedios Group

texts.es:
El grupo de nombre Virgen de los Remedios, se formó en la ciudad de Caaguazú, se encuentran trabajando dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde cada una quiere mejorar sus condiciones de vida por medio del trabajo unido.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Rumilda quien es vendedora de frutas y verduras, es una mujer muy trabajadora que poco a poco se ha abierto camino y ya es muy conocida por el buen trabajo que viene haciendo. Ella es una persona muy luchadora y sacrificada.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar frutas y verduras frescas, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar y seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The Virgen de los Remedios group was formed in the city of Caaguazú. They are working within the elimination of poverty program, in which each one wants to better her quality of life through working together.

One of the borrowers is Rumilda, who sells fruit and vegetables. She is a very hardworking person, who little by little has made her mark and now is well known for the good work she is doing. She is a fighter and a self sacrificing person.

She seeks this loan to buy fresh fruits and vegetables, in order to continue in her business as she has been doing. She is thankful for this opportunity to be able to improve and continue helping her family.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Lilibeth, quien con su credikiva pudo invertir en una nueva idea de negocio “Un café Internet” y beneficiar a los miembros de su comunidad que anteriormente no disponían de un establecimiento cerca a sus hogares que les permitiera gozar de estos servicios. Así mismo accedió a una tasa de interés baja y desde que recibió su crédito sus ingresos se incrementaron, sin embargo al presentarse un daño en un computador, disminuyo su capacidad de servicios.  Lilibeth envía un mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva “Estoy muy agradecida porque con el crédito puedo trabajar en mi casa y seguir cuidando a mis hijos”. En la actualidad está aplicando su segundo credikiva, con el cual comprará un equipo de cómputo de escritorio y accederá a un servicio de internet más veloz. Su credikiva nuevamente será todo un éxito y responderá oportunamente a los requerimientos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Thanks for supporting Lilibeth, who with her Kiva loan was able to invest in a new business idea, an internet café. This benefitted members of her community who previously had no establishment near their homes that allowed them to enjoy such services. She also received a low interest rate and once she received the loan, her income increased. However, when one of the computers was damaged, her service capability decreased.

Lilibeth sends this message to the Kiva lenders: "I am very thankful because with the loan I can work from home and continue caring for my children." She now seeks a second loan from Kiva to buy a desktop computer and obtain faster internet service. Her loan will be a big success again, and she will be able to respond opportunely to the needs of her customers.

loans.use: comprará un equipo de cómputo de escritorio y accederá a un servicio de internet más veloz

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en:
Laurence is married and has four children, two of them still attending school in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy items such as sugar, crates of sodas, cooking oil, and other items to sell. Laurence still runs a retail shop of general merchandise and also earns additional income from coffee, banana and dairy farming. He sells milk mainly to nearby people and to the trading center.

Laurence has been farming for more than 33 years and loves being active at work. He works ten hours a day, six days per week, which has enabled him to improve his standards of living. Laurence is a good father and his vision is to educate his children up to a degree level as a minimum qualification. He also plans to expand his shop into a wholesale store. Inadequate capital, high rental costs and license fees limit him from fulfilling his plans. Laurence is seeking financial support to buy more soap, bread and sugar to sell.

loans.use: to buy more soap, bread and sugar to sell

loans.name: Grupo Trabajadores De Chuilajkalquix Group

texts.es: Rosalio (el primero del lado derecho de la foto) es un gran hombre y un excelente padre de familia de 59 años de edad, es casado, Rosalio su mayor satisfacción es que su familia tenga todo lo necesario, Rosalio cuenta que gracias al crédito pudo realizar la inversión en su negocio de venta de cortes típicos y a Dios gracias para él fue muy beneficioso porque ahora ya vende blusas típicas también, con este cambio Rosalio está contento mas no así conforme es la razón por la cual él solicita un nuevo préstamo para la compra de más ropa típica y así lograr satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los clientes, comprando ropa de buena calidad y sobre todo modernas. El guarda las esperanzas de contar nuevamente con este crédito para seguir prosperando con su negocio.
texts.en: Rosalio (the first from the right side of the photo) is a great man and excellent father. He is 59 years old and married. Rosalio's greatest satisfaction is that his family has all that they need. Rosalio says that thanks to the [previous] loan he was able to make the investment in his business selling typical styles, and thanks to God for he was very beneficial because now he sells typical blouses as well. With this change, Rosalio is happy, and more so because it is not the reason he is seeking a new loan for the purchase of more traditional clothing--it is to be able to satisfy the needs of his customers better by buying clothing of good quality and, above all, modern. He holds on to the hopes of counting on a loan again to continue prospering with his business.

loans.use: to buy typical clothing.

loans.name: Julio

texts.en:
Julio is 39 years old. He has his own house and he works as a journalist for a newspaper located at La Paz. Julio needs a loan to fix a room at his house.

Julio is single but he lives with his parents and he helps them a lot with the expenses. He hopes you can help him to have a better place to live.

loans.use: to fix a room at his house

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia works at a printing place; she has experience with sewing books and magazines.

Patricia needs a loan to fix the walls at the house where she lives. She lives with her parents, and she helps them with the expenses.

She hopes you can help her because she is the only support for her parents.

Patricia is single; she doesn't have children, but she works hard and she would like to go to college.

loans.use: to fix the walls at the house where she lives

loans.name: Mujeres De Chichuj Group

texts.en:
The word, “Aguacatán” means a place where there is an abundance of avocados and those grown in Guatemala are huge and flavorful. It is also the name of a town southeast of Huehuetenango in the northeastern part of Guatemala. The area is quite mountainous and lush and one can find many natural springs that are the headwaters to rivers in the area.. Poor economic conditions have prompted some of the people who live here to travel elsewhere in Guatemala to work while many have gone to Mexico and the United States.

Seven women who strive to conserve their beautiful traditional clothing have decided to fortify themselves and formed the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Mujeres de Chichuj”. The ladies are hardworking and driven to achieve success. They have various businesses such as farming (growing and selling onions and tomatoes), selling tortillas and tamales, and animal husbandry and in their “free time”, the women embroider beautiful and colorful typical blouses….all to increase income.

Celeste is a member of the Trust Bank. She is 33 years old with one child. She was able to attend school until the fifth grade. Celeste grows onions and tomatoes. With the earnings from her sales of produce, she buys baby chicks to raise and sell. In addition, she embroiders typical blouses! She is requesting a loan to buy a large quantity of onion seeds, 400 small tomato plants and fertilizer so that all will flourish in the ground and produce high quality tomatoes and onions.

The ladies in the “Aguacatan” Trust Bank look forward to their monthly meetings when they make payments on their loans and participate in educational trainings. Friendship Bridge calls the combination of microcredit and education “Microcredit Plus” and it is very effective. A facilitator from the organization shares relevant information with the women on a variety of topics including health, hygiene and nutrition, setting goals and realizing dreams as well as how to get their children ready for school. Also discussed are effective business tools including planning, budgeting, pricing, marketing and customer service.

Each Kiva lender who decides to fund loans for Celeste and her friends is truly appreciated. Thank you for your compassion and your generosity!

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of onion seeds, 400 small tomato plants and fertilizer so that all will flourish in the ground and produce high quality tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es:
El  Sr. Nelson es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene un lavadero en su casa, con muchos clientes porque el servicio que realiza es excelente y también por la ubicación de su local.
Con mucho sacrificio pudo montar su negocio y hoy le va muy bien, es una persona muy luchadora que pone todo de sí para poder crecer y salir adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar un compresor de aire para poder seguir realizando mejor cada día su trabajo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y mejorando.
texts.en:
Nelson is from the city of Santaní. He has a car wash service at home, with many clients since he gives excellent service and also due to its location.

He was able to start his business with a lot of sacrifice and it is now going very well. He works hard, intending to grow and get ahead.

Nelson is applying for this loan to buy an air compressor so that he can do a better job every day. He is grateful for this opportunity to continue growing and getting better.

loans.use: to buy an air compressor.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en: Edwin is a hardworking father of two adult-aged children. He raised them well so that both of them were college scholars. Edwin has supported his family through his sari-sari (convenience store) business. He recalls that Paglaum MPC came to his rescue when he needed capital after suffering business losses. Edwin has just recently asked for a loan from the cooperative to restock his store with consumable items such as canned goods, noodles, coffee, milk, condiments, confectioneries and others.

loans.use: to restock his store with consumable items such as canned goods, noodles, coffee, milk, condiments, confectioneries and others.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 21 years old and single with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Marivic runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, drinks, bread, milk, coffee, spices, shampoo, soap, sugar, etc.

Marivic has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Marivic would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, drinks, bread, milk, coffee, spices, shampoo, soap, and sugar

loans.name: Janneth Lucia

texts.es:
Janneth es una joven trabajadora, tiene 24 años, tiene 2 hijos de 4 años y 3 meses respectivamente, vive en casa propia pero no ha podido ponerla a su nombre ya que es pequeña para poder tener una escritura a su nombre. Vive en unión libre con su espeso Henry de 23 años, él trabaja desde hace 3 años en una Hostería. Su hijo estudia inicial 2 en un una institución pública.
Janneth se dedica al comercio de plásticos desde hace 3 meses, lo emprendió como iniciativa propia, ella compra sus productos en la cuidad de Atuntaqui para luego venderlos en restaurantes y mercados de la cuidad de Ibarra. Tiene 2 motos, una la utiliza su esposo y la otra la utiliza ella para poder entregar sus productos en los distintos lugares que ella visita. Solicita un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de capital de trabajo y de esta forma poder vender sus productos en más lugares de la ciudad. Agradece a KIVA por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Janneth is a hard-working young woman. She is 24 years old, has 2 children, 4 years and 3 months old, respectively, lives in her own house but has not been able to put it in her name since it is too small to be able to have it registered in her name. She is in a common-law marriage with her husband Henry, age 23. He has worked for 3 years in a hotel. Her child is in the second year of preschool in a public school. 

Janneth has worked selling plastics for 3 months. She began with her own initiative. She purchases her products in the city of Atuntaqui to later sell them in restaurants and markets in the city of Ibarra. She has 2 motorcycles. Her husband uses one and she uses the other to be able to deliver the products to the different places she visits. She asks for a loan to invest it in the purchase of working capital and in this way be able to sell her products to more places in the city. she is grateful to Kiva for the offered help.

loans.use: to undertake her own business in plastic products; she has her husband's support for her personal and professional growth.

loans.name: Enrique

texts.en:
Enrique is a 51-year-old man. He is divorced and has a child who relies economically on him. Enrique was an accounts man for 18 years of his life. He used to work for the government, but he decided that he did not enjoy his work, so he went to Europe to rediscover himself. He took nothing but a guitar, and there he decided to become a musician.

He came back to Mexico and become a "Mariachi" (typical Mexican musician). He is pictured in the typical mariachi outfit. Then he created a band with some friends.

Now he makes a living from playing typical Mexican music with his friends. It has been 12 years since he created his band. He was doing well until his sound mixer was stolen, and now, in order to buy a new one, he is looking for a 10,000 MXN loan.

At Kubo, we are certain that he will succeed because he is a man who loves what he does, and he has the determination to accomplish his dreams.

loans.use: to buy a sound mixer.

loans.name: Jeannette

texts.en:
Jeannette is a sari-sari store owner from Baybay, Leyte. She is a 35 year old married woman with a nine year old son.

Jeanette has been engaged in her sari-sari store business for 10 years. She is asking for a loan to buy grocery items such as chips, candies, biscuits, bread, noodles, canned goods, spices, cooking oil, toiletries, sugar, coffee, powdered chocolate drink and soft drinks.

In the future, she wishes to improve her business to have a sustainable life.

loans.use: to buy chips, candies, biscuits, bread, noodles, canned goods, spices, cooking oil, toiletries, sugar, coffee, powdered chocolate drink and soft drinks

loans.name: Marifi

texts.en:
Marifi is 43 years old with 2 school age children.

Marifi owns a nursery that sells a variety of seedlings for farming. She ventured into this type of business knowing there is a growing demand for seedlings and nobody is offering this in her area. Recently, she asked for a loan from PMPC to buy additional seeds for her nursery business.

loans.use: buy additional seeds for her nursery business.

loans.name: Hilda Arely

texts.es: Hilda tiene 25 años de edad habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañero de vida y su querida madre de 60 años y su pequeña hija de 3 años de edad, es una joven que siempre demuestra su espíritu de superación ya que es quien ayuda a su madre y cuida de su hija. Hilda se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos desde hace 2 años por el cual es su fuente de ingresos y además buscando la manera de obtener más ingreso sale a lavar ajeno para poder llevar el sustento al hogar. Hilda desea comprar más pollos de engorde para criarlos y luego venderlos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: pollos de engorde, concentrado y vitaminas para así cumplir con la demanda que solicitan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Hilda is 25 years old and lives in her own home with her life partner, her beloved 60 year old mother, and her small 3 year old daughter. She is a young woman who always shows a spirit of self improvement, as she both helps her mother and takes care of her daughter.

For two years Hilda has worked raising and selling chickens, which is her source of income. In addition, looking for a way to increase her income, she also washes clothes for others, in order to be able to meet the family expenses.

Hilda would like to buy more broiler chickens, in order to raise them and later sell them. For this reason she seeks a loan from FUSAI to invest in broiler chickens, concentrated feed and vitamins to meet the demand of her clients.

loans.use: to invest in broiler chickens, concentrated feed and vitamins in order to meet the demand of her customers.

loans.name: Rodivico

texts.en: Rodivico fulfilled his dreams of becoming the boss of his own business. He is into retailing of various consumable items that a household usually needs. He finds joy in retailing, especially when he is making good sales. He wants to add more stock of consumable items like canned goods, soy sauce, vinegar, cooking oil, confectionary and other items to his store with so he is asking for a loan from the cooperative.

loans.use: to stock his store with consumable items like canned goods, soy sauce, vinegar, cooking oil, confectionary and other items.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a married woman. She is 56 years old with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Evangeline has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year. Evangeline requested a PHP 4,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like bananas, sugar, cooking oil and other materials for her food production business.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like bananas, sugar, cooking oil and other materials for her food production business.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a longtime borrower of Hofokam Limited, in Kamwenge, Uganda. He used his previous loan to buy soap, sugar, salt, crates of sodas and beers to sell. He is a focused old man, and is married, with six children. Four are still attending school, which makes him very happy. He desires to expand his shop and also to educate his children to higher levels, as he thinks education is the best thing he can leave for his beloved children.

He operates a retail shop selling general merchandise, and also gets supplementary income from crop farming, which helps him earn a living. He works for 8 hours a day throughout the whole week, and has been in business for five years now. Bad debtors and competition from other traders in the same business limit him from achieving his dream. Thomas is requesting for a loan to buy more salt, soap and sugar to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy more salt, soap and sugar to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es:
Gabriel, de 23 años de edad, está soltero, vive solo con su mamá y dos hermanos, pero solo su mamá depende de él.

Gabriel, se dedica a la crianza de ganado desde hace 3 años, todo lo que sabe lo aprendió de su tío y su negocio lo tiene a 5 minutos de su casa y con él trabaja un primo. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar ganado, con esta inversión espera mejorar su negocio porque tendrá más ingresos para él y su familia. 

Sus sueños son, tener una ganadería grande y ser muy reconocido por su trabajo.
texts.en:
Gabriel is 23 years old and single. He lives with his mother and two siblings, but only his mother depends on him. Gabriel has worked raising cattle for 3 years. Everything he knows he learned from his uncle. His business is 5 minutes from his house, and he works with a cousin.

He needs a loan to buy cattle. With this investment he hopes to improve his business so that he will have more income for him and his family. His dreams are to have a big cattle farm and to be known for his work.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Jayson

texts.en: Jayson and his wife are engaged in various businesses to earn a living. He sells coconut wine, drives a motorcycle and raises pigs. They also own a farm. Jayson works hard to provide the needs of the family. Thus, he is a 33-year-old man and has young children, ages nine, seven, three and one. He is asking for a loan to buy “tungog” (a tannin powder used to give color to the coconut wine). He will also use the loan he is requesting to buy piglets and feed. In the future, he wishes to expand his business to have a sustainable life.

loans.use: to buy "tungog", piglets and feed

loans.name: Alvie

texts.en:
Alvie has been in the copra buying business for 10 years. It gives her an approximate monthly income of PHP 12,000. She is 36 years old, married, with one infant age child.

Alvie has been an active member of Paglaum MPC since 2012 when she needed access to additional capital for her business. Currently, she is applying for a loan to restock her sari-sari store inventory. She wanted to venture into another business for additional income.

loans.use: to restock her sari-sari store inventory.

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina, 49, is married and has three children. For the past fifteen years she has raised hogs as a business in Ozamiz City, Philippines.

Antonina took out and successfully repaid a previous loan through Kiva's field partner Paglaum MPC to construct her pig pen, and she now makes approximately 12,000 PHP a month through this business. She has applied here for a 15,000 PHP to buy bags of feed for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy bags of feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a restaurant. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to have more business outlets within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab, a married mother of six, describes herself as loyal. For five years she has operated a tailoring business where she makes clothes. Her business is located in a populated place, and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

Zainab will use this Kes 30,000 loan, her third with SMEP Microfinance Bank, to buy a sewing machine. Her business goal is to have more tailoring shops within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Tina Angelica

texts.es: Tina tiene 34 años de edad es madre soltera habita en casa familiar junto a sus dos hijas de 14 años y 10 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que desde muy temprano anda ya en sus labores diarias ya que ella se dedica a la venta de tamales de pollo desde hace 2 años para ver de poder ayudar a sus dos hijas en sus estudios. Tina desea comprar más ingredientes para seguir con la venta de tamales ya que son muchas las personas que le compran  y así obtener más ganancias, por lo que solicita a FUSAI para invertir en: maíz, pollo, hojas de huerta, especies, papas, manteca, para así poder cumplir con la demanda que solicitan sus clientes.
texts.en:
Tina is a 34-year-old single mother.  She lives in her family home with her two 14-year-old and 10-year-old daughters.  She is a hard-working woman who gets up very early to start her household chores.   She has made a living selling chicken tamales for two years in order to help her children get an education.  Tina wants to buy more ingredients to continue making tamales since she has many customers and she would be able to make a better profit.  

Therefore, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy corn, chicken, vegetable leaves, spices, potatoes, and lard, in order to be able to keep up with the demand of her customers.

loans.use: to buy corn, chicken, vegetable leaves, spices, potatoes, and lard so that she can keep up with the demand of her customers.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia has run a general store in Ozamiz City for the past twenty years. Her profits are enough to support her family.

Delia has borrowed and successfully repaid previous loans through Kiva's field partner Paglaum MPC. She has now applied for a 50,000 PHP loan to buy goods such as meat, rice, corn, animal feed and other merchandise to restock her store.

loans.use: to buy goods such as meat, rice, corn, animal feed and other merchandise to restock her store.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a 57-year-old married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Elsie has a food vending business in the Philippines. Elsie requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, pork, fish, chicken meat, spices and other materials for her food production business.

Elsie has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, pork, fish, chicken meat, spices and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Махбуба жительница района Рудаки. Ей 34 лет. Она замужем и мать двоих детей. Ее муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации.  У нее два сына. Детям  8 и 5 лет.   Махбуба занимается шитьем женской одежды. Она занимается  этой деятельностью более  4 лет. Ей  в этой деятельности нравится ежедневный доход, а также она обожает шить и кроить. Махбуба давно хочет отремонтировать свой дом. Но так как на эту цель у нее нет достаточных финансовых средств, она решилась обратиться за кредитом. В будущем она планирует купить новую многофункциональную швейную машинку, чтобы расширить  и улучшить свою деятельность. Махбуба надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Mahbuba lives in the Rudaki region. She is 34 years old. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation. She has two sons, eight and five years old. Mahbuba works sewing women's clothing. She has been in this business for over four years. She appreciates having an ongoing source of income, and enjoys sewing and making dress patterns.

Mahbuba would like to renovate her home. Since she lacks the necessary financial means, she decided to apply for a loan. In the future she plans to buy a new multifunctional sewing machine in order to expand and improve her business. Mahbuba hopes for your support.

loans.use: to renovate her home.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 56 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su esposo y sus tres queridos hijos de 16 años, 14 años y 10 años de edad a quienes están sacando adelante en sus estudios, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que desde muy temprano está realizando sus actividades para su venta. Rosa se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas y venta de típicos y gracias a este negocio es como mantiene la economía del hogar, y gracias a su experiencia y amabilidad cada día son más las personas que gustan de sus productos, pues demuestra que es una mujer muy emprendedora. Rosa desea comprar más materia prima para vender más en su negocio y así poder contar con una mayor cantidad de clientes, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: maíz, papa, aceite, repollo, bolsas,  carne, etc., para obtener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa is 56 years old lives in the home she owns with their husband and their three beloved children of 16, 14, and 10 years of age who are forging ahead with their studies. She is a hardworking woman who has been conducting her business for a long time. Rosa earns her living making and selling tortillas and the sale of traditional foods. Thanks to her business she is contributing to the household economy. Every day, more people enjoy her products. It shows that she's a very enterprising woman.

Rosa wants to buy more ingredients to increase sales in your business so she can have a larger number of customers, therefore, she requests a loan from FUSAI to invest in corn, potatoes, cooking oil, cabbage, bags, meat, etc., to earn more profits.

loans.use: to purchase corn, potatoes, cooking oil, cabbage, bags, meat, and more to earn more income.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Manuel tiene 70 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su grupo familiar el cual lo conforman 5 integrantes el es un hombre muy trabajador que con mucho esfuerzo ha sacado adelante a su familia. Manuel se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan francés y a la venta de huevos frescos desde hace 3 años lo cual es su fuente de ingresos, por lo que gracias a su experiencia y su amabilidad cada día son más las personas que gustan de sus productos, pues demuestra que es un hombre responsable. Manuel desea comprar más materia prima para la elaboración de pan francés y comprar más huevos para vender más en su negocio  y así poder contar con una mayor cantidad de cliente, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: harina, levadura, manteca, sal, bandejas, azúcar, y de esta manera tener una mayor cantidad de productos para ofrecer a su clientela, mejorando sus ingresos y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel is 70 years old. He lives in his own house with his family which is made up of five members. He is very hard-working and with much effort has gotten his family ahead. Manuel has worked making and selling French bread and selling eggs for the past three years and this is his source of income. Thanks to his experience and his friendliness every day there are more people who like his products as he has shown himself to be a responsible man.

Manuel wants to buy more raw material to make French bread and buy more eggs to sell more in his business. Doing this he can expect a greater number of clients. So he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in flour, yeast, margarine, salt, trays and sugar and in this way have a greater quantity of products to offer his clients, improving his revenues and his quality of living.

loans.use: to invest in flour, yeast, margarine, salt, trays and sugar and in this way have a greater quantity of products to offer his clients.

loans.name: Paterna

texts.en: Paterna is a pensioner member of Paglaum MPC and has availed various loans already. She enjoys the perks of membership including life insurance. Now that she wants to have major repairs and maintenance done to her house, she is asking for a loan from the co-op. The amount she borrows will be used to purchase housing materials such as bags of cement, plywood, nails and others items.

loans.use: to purchase housing materials such as bags of cement, plywood, nails and other items.

loans.name: Visitacion

texts.en: Visitacion is a pensioner member of Paglaum MPC, wherein she enjoys the perks and benefits of membership. She has been a member of the cooperative since April 13, 2012 and has requested various loan products. In need of an amount to purchase maintenance medicines and vitamins, she asks for a loan of PHP 30,000.

loans.use: to purchase maintenance medicines and vitamins

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Zendy

texts.en: Zendy has supplied corn in the city of Ozamiz since 1995. She is 32 years old and married with one school-aged child. She has also been a member of Paglaum MPC for almost one year. She requested a loan from the coop to buy high-yielding corn seeds and bags of fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy high-yielding corn seeds and bags of fertilizers.

loans.name: Melina

texts.en: Melina has a collection of ornamental garden plants. She finds pleasure in doing her gardening activities as well as in earning money for her family. As a microfinance member of PMPC, she is seeking financial help to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell. In the future, Melina wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of ornamental plants that she can grow and sell.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is 61 years old. She is known in the Ozamiz City area for her rice production business. She is actively participating in the various programs and services that the coop offers. She hopes to live comfortably, with a decent house, for which she applied for a loan to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks. She hopes to maintain her membership in good standing with a good repayment record. It matters that she has been given a priority as a microfinance member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC). This is what she is thankful for, when all her financing needs of her retailing business are supported by PMPC.

loans.use: to purchase plywood, nails, and sticks for her house.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can request financial assistance for her chosen business. Rita has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. Recently she requested a loan to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins for her chosen business. Rita wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feeds and animal vitamins

location.town: Pagadian - Pagadian City, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a married woman with three children. She describes herself as focused. She operates a restaurant. Her business is located in a busy place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be that her business premise space is small. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be financially independent. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Zabibu

texts.en: Zabibu is a Kiva borrower. She has three children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to have a good business premise within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is a single man. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail business where he sells fruits. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a strategic place and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the lack of funds. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits. His business goal is to be a supplier of fruits to supermarkets within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will own a fruit juice company. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en: Rehema is a married woman with three children. She describes herself as focused. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy residential area and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. Her business goal is to have another business outlet within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be successful in business. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 50 years old and married with four children.

Evangeline works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, drinks, bread, milk, coffee, spices, shampoo, soap, sugar, etc.

She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from food vending.

Evangeline aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, drinks, bread, milk, coffee, spices, shampoo, soap, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
As a single parent of four children, Emelita works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from rice retailing. Emelita is borrowing PHP 4,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials like thread, needles, yards of cloths and maintenance for her tailoring business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like thread, needles,  yards of cloths and maintenance for her business

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a 32 year old hardworking married man with three children aged 3, 8 and 10 years old. He lives in Kamwenge, Uganda. He operates a retail shop but also earns additional income from a local hotel. He loves to remain active as he grows old, that’s why he works for eleven hours each of the seven days worked in the week.

Edward has been running the shop for more than seven years and with the proceeds he has been able to get an income and provide for his family. All his children attend school and that is his happiness. He wishes to expand his business to a wholesale shop but is limited by inadequate capital and the price fluctuations of retail products. He is requesting a loan to buy crates of soda, salt and powdered soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy crates of soda, salt and powdered soap to sell.

loans.name: Alba Patricia

texts.es: Alba tiene 23 años de edad es madre soltera habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su pequeño hijo de 4 años de edad a quien le está dando todo el cuido necesario y que no le falte nada, ella es una joven que siempre demuestra su espíritu de superación es una mujer luchadora que siempre sale adelante. Ella cuenta con una pequeña sala de belleza en la cual ella obtiene sus ingresos económicos y además buscando la manera de obtener más ingresos económicos quiere comprar ropa para vender y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: camisas, blusas, trajes para niños, ropa interior, faldas, licras, etc. Y así obtener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Alba is 23 years old. She is a single mother. She lives in her own home along with her young 4 year-old son. She gives him all of the care he needs, and is making sure he is not wanting for anything.

This young woman's indomitable spirit is always apparent; she is a woman who always gets ahead.

She earns her income from a small beauty salon. She is also looking for a way to earn more income by buying clothing to sell. This is how she hopes to improve her quality of life.

This is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in shirts, blouses, clothing for children, underwear, skirts, leggings, etc. in order to earn a better income.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, clothing for children, underwear, skirts, leggings, etc. in order to earn a better income.

loans.name: Always Smile - N02Tsơn1Psơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thanh is 64 years old and married. She has operated a food stall selling fruit for three years. Thanh lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Thanh faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fresh fruit to resell.

In 2012, Thanh joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Since then, her income increased, so that she could cover the cost of living more easily and buy some furniture for her family. Thanh has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

She is the group leader of Always smile - N02TSơn1PSơn, which consists of four members. In the future, Thanh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fruit to resell.

loans.name: Renilda

texts.en:
Renilda hails from the town of Talibon, Bohol. She is a 45-year-old widow woman with three children. Her oldest child is 25 while the youngest is 18.

She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various commodities like biscuits, noodles, edible oil, seasonings, beverages, soft drinks and toiletries.

She is asking for a loan to buy rice, soft drinks and assorted stocks. These will help improve the stocks of her store and enable her to control the inventory of the merchandise. Thus, she can continue to serve her customers' orders. Her income will increase and she will be able to provide her family with nutritious diets.

Renilda would like to expand her business to become sustainable so she can support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy rice, soft drinks and assorted stocks

loans.name: Philiciah

texts.en: Philiciah is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be humble. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. Her business is located in a residential place and her primary customers are women. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will live a comfortable life. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en: Gerald is a married man with one child. He describes himself as patient. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, salt, flour, soda and other items. He has been involved in this business for four years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, salt, flour and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale shop within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, salt, flour and other items

loans.name: Dany Armando

texts.es:
Dany vende ropa y calzado, el negocio lo ha fundado por motivación propia y para subsistir, el negocio lo atiende con ayuda de su madre, él vive en casa de ella y es padre un niño de dos años de edad el cual está vive en otro casa con su mamá, pero él es responsable de sus gastos, no representa dificultades para continuar trabajando.
El financiamiento le permitirá tener recursos económicos para comprar variedades de prendas de vestir con nuevos estilos y además mejorara la infraestructura del local en está el negocio, tendrá un mejor inventario y sus clientes apreciaran una imagen más agradable de su negocio, espera tener resultados positivos con la inversión.
Su objetivo es llegar a tener un negocio más grande y que sea autosostenible.
texts.en:
Dany sells clothing and footwear.  He started this business to fulfill his personal goals and  to survive.  He runs the business with the help of his mother.  He lives in her home and he is the father of a two-year-old who lives in a different home with his mother, but he is responsible for his expenses.  He shouldn't have any problems continuing to work.  

The loan will allow him to have the necessary economic resources to buy a variety of clothing in new styles and also to improve the infrastructure of his business location.  He will have a larger inventory and be able to project a better image to his customers. He hopes to obtain positive results from the loan.

His goal is to be able to have a bigger business that is self-sustainable.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing in new styles and also to improve the infrastructure of his business location.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase animal feeds.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 41 years old. She is married and has five children.

Her business is growing maize, beans and cow peas. She has been in the business for 13 years.

She earns a monthly income of 10,000 Kenya shillings. This is her first loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy farm inputs, seeds and fertilizer.

She will use the profits from her expanded business to pay school fees for her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to become a large-scale farmer

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 36 years old. She is married and has three children. Her business is selling fruits and vegetables. She has been in the business for seven years. She earns a monthly income of 10,000 Kes.

This is her third loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy stock of spinach, kale, cabbage, tomatoes, onions, etc.


She will use the profits from the expanded business to put back into the business to increase her stock. Her hopes and dreams are to have a large business.

loans.use: to buy stock of spinach, kale, tomatoes, onions, rice, sugar, soap, etc. for both her shop and her green grocery.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia wants to thank Center for Community Transformation (CCT) and all Kiva lenders for considering her previous loan application. Without the assistance, she would not know how to survive in the business every time there is something that needs to be fixed on the vehicle, since she lacks supplementary capital. She has used the loan to buy spare parts and pay for maintenance costs of her jeepney unit. Her monthly earnings in this business reach approximately PHP 16,000. Aside from being a jeepney operator, Leticia also owns a house rental that provides an additional PHP 6,300 in earnings each month.

Leticia wants to have the spare funds needed for paying the maintenance cost of her jeepney. Due to this, she applied for another loan of PHP 45,000 and Leticia prays that God will touch the hearts of those people who will read her story again.

Leticia believes that if you want success to arrive, you need God to be your greatest foundation. Leticia dreams of starting another business in the near future. She is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gains spiritual strength for members' life changing testimony, shares her own experience of God’s love, pays microfinance loans and hears God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to have the spare funds needed to pay the maintenance cost of her jeepney.

loans.name: Santos Isabel

texts.es:
Santos manifiesta que la remodelación del nuevo mercado municipal ha finalizado, le han reasignado su puesto y necesita de un nuevo crédito para comprar maya metálica con la debe establecer los límites de su puesto de venta de comida, espera mantener sus ventas en las nuevas instalaciones.
Con la ayuda del crédito anterior pudo mantener en vigencia su negocio, el cual tenía ubicado en un puesto provisional, le permitió mantener la lealtad de sus clientes y su fuente de ingresos con vida.
texts.en:
Santos states that the remodeling of the new municipal market is finished, They have reassigned her stall and she needs a new loan in order to buy wire mesh which she can use to delineate the perimeter of her food sales stall. She hopes to maintain her sales levels in the new facilities.

With the help of the previous loan, she was able to keep her business running which had been located in a temporary stall. It allowed her to maintain the loyalty of her customers and to keep her source of income alive.

loans.use: to buy metal mesh to establish the perimeters of her food sales stall.

loans.name: Hector Rene

texts.es:
Héctor, de 39 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, su estado civil es viudo, tiene dos hijos que actualmente están estudiando, uno estudia en la Universidad y el otro estudia segundo grado.  

Héctor, desde hace 18 años se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, lo aprendió por medio de su padre, pero además siembra 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, para alimentar su ganado y las vacas lecheras que tiene.- 
Héctor, alquila las tierras para tener su ganado a 15 minutos de su casa.  

Héctor, necesita el préstamo para comprar más ganado, especialmente terneras para alimentarlas, crecerlas y reproducirlas, ya que cuenta con los conocimientos necesarios para lograrlo y luego poder venderlas a un buen precio. 

Los sueños de Héctor son, seguir trabajando con ganado, para poder pagar los gastos de estudios de sus hijos y cubrir los gastos del hogar y en un futuro desea tener una ganadería lechera.
texts.en:
Héctor is 39 years old and studied until high school.  He is a widower.  He has two children who are in school right now.  One goes to college and the other one is in the second grade.  

Héctor has made a living buying and selling livestock for 18 years.  He learned the trade from his father.  He also plants 14,000 square meters of corn to feed his livestock and the milk cows that he has.  He rents land so that he can keep his livestock only 15 minutes away from his home.  

Héctor needs a loan to buy more livestock, especially calves to feed, raise, and breed, since he has the know-how to carry out this work and later sell the calves at a good price. 

Héctor's dreams are to continue working with livestock so that he can pay for his children's educational expenses and household expenses, and in the future he wants to have a dairy farm.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Zaheer

texts.en:
Zaheer is a 37-year-old man, residing in Wazirabad, Pakistan. He is a father of two daughters and one son. He has been running a business manufacturing steel and iron knives and scissors for many years. This business is the only financial support for the entire family.

The specialty of his manufacturing business is that he is a trained knife and scissor maker using raw steel and iron. He owns a different variety of machines to work at making knives and scissors. People in the society like his knife and scissor collection a lot. That is the reason his current business is running well and increasing day by day.

He decided to increase his current business but the main issue is of sufficient amount. Therefore Zaheer is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan because he has to purchase more stock of raw iron and steel rods and bars for manufacturing purposes. Zaheer is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw material for his own knife and scissor-making business.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es: José un hombre responsable y trabajador de 52 años de edad casado y con dos hijos de 6 y 7 años de edad viven en casa propia. José se dedica a prestar sus servicios como albañil de forma independiente y es con esos ingresos que lleva el sustento a su familia. El desea mejorar su vivienda es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, grava, hierro, lámina y solaires, para poder hacer el cambio de techo, colocar ventanas y encementar el piso de su vivienda, y de esta manera cuidar de la salud de su familia.
texts.en:
José is a responsible and hard-working man. He is 52 years old, married, with two children, ages 6 and 7. They live in their own home.

He is an independent builder, and he supports his family with the income that he earns.

He wants to make improvements to his home, so he is asking for a loan from FUSAI, which he will invest in cement, gravel, rebar, sheet metal and windows in order to replace his roof, hang windows and cement the floor of his home, and in this way, look after his family's health.

loans.use: to buy cement, gravel, rebar, sheet metal and windows, to be able to replace his roof, hang windows and cement his floor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for sheet metal, wood, nails, and labor to repair her home.

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 29 years old. He is married and has two children.

His business is operating a motorcycle transport business as well as farming. He has been in these businesses for eight years and they have been profitable.

Emmanuel earns a monthly income of 19,000 Kenya shillings. This is his fifth loan from VisionFund Kenya.

He will use the loan to service the motorcycle and buy animal feeds for his cattle.

He will use the profits from his expanded business to service the loan and increase his savings, as well as meeting the family needs. His hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to service the motorcycle and buy animal feeds for his cattle

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 24 years old. She is married and has one child. Her business is farming and livestock keeping. She has been in the business for seven years. She earns a monthly income of 21,000 Kenya shillings.

This is her third loan from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy a cow. She will use the profits from expanded business to save and buy more cows for rearing. Her hopes and dreams are to have a good future.

loans.use: to buy a cow.
